'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-05-10 19:19:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I tested the code at runtime adding some sleeps and editing the pidfile so that it matched the pid of some other stale metadata proxy.

As excepted it did not find the uuid of the router, and then spawn the proxy.
But should we have all this stale PIDs? I think Maru has a bug on this, but it's for RHEL, whereas I am running ubuntu."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2013-05-10 19:19:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> But should we have all this stale PIDs? I think Maru has a bug on this, but it's for RHEL, whereas I am running ubuntu.

It's probably a rare occurrence for this to happen, but we're running hundreds and hundreds of namespaces, so after a reboot there are a lot of stale pid files around.  And when it happens only manual editing or removal of that stale pid file will help.

After looking into it I noticed the code in the ProcessManager class (quantum/agent/linux/external_process.py) used by the L3 and DHCP agents does a similar check, using the uuid as the search item since it's more unique than the process name alone.

This was seen on an Ubuntu 12.04 system, running Grizzly.final too, no RHEL here."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2013-05-10 19:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-10 19:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Code looks good. I just need to test.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-05-10 19:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-05-10 19:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-10 19:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Change Daemon class to better match process command lines.

Add additional uuid argument Daemon class to help it better
match output from /proc/$id/cmdline to the correct daemon.
If there is a stale pid in the pidfile, and that process has
the same name, then it could match accidentally and not
start the daemon up properly.

Fixes bug 1177416

Change-Id: I1109ca73c539c5e96cbe3dbb55ce68c92013ee10

commit_message:
Fix usage of SQLAlchemy Query.first() method

Query.first() doesn't raise the NoResultFound exception
if no result is found but rather returns None, so wrapping
of Query.first() call into a try/except NoResultFound block
is useless.

Fixes bug 1177842.

Change-Id: I0bd0e6d8299734b485dd1a1ac36bf6c295fd8932

commit_message:
Fix usage of NexusPortBindingNotFound exception

Currently the required keyword argument (port_id)
is not passed when the exception is raised. In fact
this exception has never been raised before due to
another bug (1173131) so this change also has to
ensure it doesn't break any existing code using
functions which can possibly raise this exception.

Fixes bug 1174323.

Change-Id: I81f0b0def7db163fb0fbb5e03be511113c8d0be5

commit_message:
Add pylint-based lintstack test to tox environment

lintstack is a pylint-based static analysis tool to find bugs
in Python code.

To run the test via tox: $ tox -e pylint
To run the test directly: $ tools/lintstack.sh

Change-Id: If155f47ed84eb820ac505ee741bdd18edd41b1eb

commit_message:
fix non reporting of failures with floating IP assignment

It seems that commit essex-1-1003-g9728ae5
inadvertently removed a 'raise', thus hiding
all processutils.ProcessExecutionError exceptions
apart from the one indicating "Interface not found".

Fix missing spaces in Huawei Logging

Add spaces between line concatenations in Log messages.

Change-Id: I4e94fc751658fbe1b6b9b74859d800445a1c2e5d

commit_message:
Revert "Disable eventlet monkey-patching of DNS"

This reverts commit 6219f94b3a1103a16bd5f16ed8ffdd41a85280e1.

This commit seems to cause keystone auth to hang when using
Keystone w/ Swift.

Fixes LP Bug #1178646.

Change-Id: Ieb94a29b3129847c84a02c8a526611f125f21ea0

'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-03-15 21:12:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The image-list parameters for v1 and v2 are different.  Is this intentional or needed?

$ glance --os-image-api-version 1 help member-list
Failed to load keyring modules.
usage: glance member-list [--image-id <IMAGE_ID>] [--tenant-id <TENANT_ID>]

Describe sharing permissions by image or tenant.

Optional arguments:
  --image-id <IMAGE_ID>
                        Filter results by an image ID.
  --tenant-id <TENANT_ID>
                        Filter results by a tenant ID.

$ glance --os-image-api-version 2 help member-list
Failed to load keyring modules.
usage: glance member-list <IMAGE_ID>

Describe sharing permissions by image

Positional arguments:
  <IMAGE_ID>  Image to display members of."}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-03-15 23:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hey JOhn,

THanks for bringing that up. It is intentional, because in v2 of glance api we cannot view image members of specific tenant id. This is because a user should not be allowed to see image members of any other tenant.'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-03-19 13:08:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

A user can have access to multiple tenants so I don't see a problem filtering by tenant id. That being said I think I agree with John, I don't want to add an inconsistency because that could be frustrating to a user but I suppose we can only do this if the api allows. Have any thoughts on this?"}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-03-25 00:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Say a user can have access to multiple tenants, but glance does not know which user has access to which tenant. Glance does not use keystone authentication to verify tenants. So basically when u are accessing image members as a particular tenant you are allowed to see only image members of the images owned by you. 
I hope that answers your question, feel free to ping me on irc if you want to discuss more or if I misunderstood you.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-04-03 21:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-04-03 21:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

we can add in additional tenant_id filter once its there in glance.'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-04-04 18:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

I would prefer to see it maintain interface compatibility as much as possible.  The v1 command takes --image-id instead of a positional argument.  However I will defer to others.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-19 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-19 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-04-23 01:10:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored

Filed bug and added some comments in, let me know your thoughts - https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1171530'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-04-29 22:54:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Could we support a positional parameter while maintaining backwards compatible support for an option (--image-id) ?

For now I'd prefer to leave off --tenant-id. If someone finds they need it, we can look at adding it to member-list as a backwards compatibility feature, while actually making it a filter on image-list.

Does this plan sound okay?"}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-05-06 22:17:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hmm I am not sure if I get you, but image id is needed in the url for glance v2 api members https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v2/router.py#L94 so it cannot be an optional parameter'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-05-08 19:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-05-08 19:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-08 20:30:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Lists, creates, deletes, updates image members using glance
v2 api.

commit_message:
Added MYSQL_HOST parameter to redstack local.sh.

Devstack now expects a MYSQL_HOST parameter without which
creating the reddwarf db fails.

Fixes bug 1178587

commit_message:
Added Region awareness to proxy
You can now add region to the proxy-config and it will try and not use the region.

Change-Id: Ia52838b6064981305ac9d8ac343546583059b884

db in your tests is the db api, not the sqlalchemy IMPL, so you don't have access unless to _remove_empty_str_volume_size unless you define it in db/api.py.  You could test indirectly through the block_device_mapping_* methods, but why not move the _remove_empty_str_volume_size method to db/api.py and modify the values as they pass through there."}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-05-08 21:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-05-08 21:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Andrew, I think it's a bit better to have _remove_empty_str_volume_size in sqlalchemy/api.py next to the code that calls it, rather than in db/api.py which is mostly do-nothing passthrough methods."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-08 21:57:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

two comments, the first is FYI, but the second one I think that instead of throwing exceptions and ignoring them we should use .get to grab it safely."}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-05-08 22:00:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-05-08 22:07:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

David, I know db/api.py is mostly dumb passthrough methods but I don't think it needs to stay that way.  We have an internal mysqldb implementation that's going to get pushed up at some point, which has to do extra work at times because all of the logic is in the sqlalchemy api.  I know in this specific case it's postgresql specific and doesn't necessarily need to be shared, but in general I don't think logic needs to stay out of db/api.py."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-08 22:28:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Parsing block_device_mapping from strings sometimes results in
volume_size being set to '' or u''.  This causes a problem when
inserting into PostgreSQL, which insists that integer columns
actually contain integers.  Remove invalid device_size before
inserting or updating block_device_mapping database records.

commit_message:
Remove invalid block_device_mapping volume_size of ''

Fixes bug #1171190

Parsing block_device_mapping from strings sometimes results in
volume_size being set to '' or u''.  This causes a problem when
inserting into PostgreSQL, which insists that integer columns
actually contain integers.  Remove invalid device_size before
inserting or updating block_device_mapping database records.

Change-Id: If9132a96604b5b0e3a6df96624e565e016d5c9a3

commit_message:
Set EVENTLET_NO_GREENDNS=yes in tox.ini.

This should allow tests to pass on Centos 6 without
the 6219f94 commit which functionally breaks swift.

Change-Id: I4a6d07abf5159d3daa4c8f9bf94e60d730ccd300

It seems that commit essex-1-1003-g9728ae5
inadvertently removed a 'raise', thus hiding
all processutils.ProcessExecutionError exceptions
apart from the one indicating "Interface not found".

Fixes bug: 1178658
Change-Id: I2bcf8c3a19ebebc81a38ce6bf7b54065d62834c0
'}]
commit_message:
fix non reporting of failures with floating IP assignment

It seems that commit essex-1-1003-g9728ae5
inadvertently removed a 'raise', thus hiding
all processutils.ProcessExecutionError exceptions
apart from the one indicating "Interface not found".

Fixes bug: 1178658
Change-Id: I2bcf8c3a19ebebc81a38ce6bf7b54065d62834c0

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-05-09 01:39:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

One more question on the DEFAULT thing. I'll send a new patch after it's clear on how we deal with it."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-09 08:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Ok, the basic goal here is that we want to support the legacy use of group names like DATABASE in config files

The way I think about it is:

1) if the API user registers a group called 'database', then we want to support reading values for the group from both database or DATABASE

This is purely about support for legacy group names in config files.

2) when the API user registers a group called 'database', then CONF.database should be how to reference it. When they register a group called 'DATABASE', then CONF.DATABASE should be how the reference it.

This ensures we're not making an incompatible API change - i.e. quantum's code will continue working and they only need to do s/CONF.DATABASE/CONF.database/ when they switch to oslo's DB code

3) the behaviour of [DEFAULT] should be unchanged so that users don't start switching to [default] and breaking existing tools

4) a deprecation warning to users/admins (i.e. a "you should fix your config file" warning) could *perhaps* be useful ... but it would need to be a one-time warning at startup per-file, not a warning every time a config value is accessed

I could live without this, though - we're not going to ever remove this case normalization semantics, so I don't think we need to be too active about getting users to switch to lowercase groups'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-09 09:16:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Thanks for the work on this

I think the normalization only needs to be done in new_section() and cparser.get()"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-05-09 14:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (4 inline comments)

Mark,

one question about "not group_name" inline'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-05-09 15:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Mark,

I get it now. If only normalized in new_section() and cparser.get(), there won't be a case where group_name is None. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-05-09 16:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-09 16:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Normalizes non lowercase option group names in conf files

To avoid inconsistency of option group name format used in conf files,
this patch normalizes group names to all lowercase names

Implements bp cfg-lowercase-groups

Change-Id: If8e6c671be776a708a7200e52e4897a8a3b90bdf

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 18:10:04.000000000', 'message': 'Convert unicode strings for python3 portability

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html

You can no longer use u"..." literals for Unicode text.
However, you must use b"..." literals for binary data. Use
python-six to make this migration easier.

Change-Id: I95166a07f4edf33be55a4bdf2674c2f238a06f19
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-05-02 14:15:44.000000000', 'message': 'Convert unicode strings for python3 portability

commit_message:
Convert unicode strings for python3 portability

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html

You can no longer use u"..." literals for Unicode text.
However, you must use b"..." literals for binary data. Use
python-six to make this migration easier.

Change-Id: I95166a07f4edf33be55a4bdf2674c2f238a06f19
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-07 05:21:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix broken mongo alarm tests

When retrieving an alarm by alarm_id we were not using the ObjectId
Also now that we are using Objectid's we can't use trivial
alarm_id's like "1" so fix this assumption in the tests.

I really don't get why jenkins said the tests passed in the initial
review.

Change-Id: I5702409b60ec6f0dd8fcc4338c9fe100c289bb36
'}, {'created': '2013-05-07 23:52:00.000000000', 'message': 'Don't use trivial alarm_id's like "1" in the test cases.

"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-07 10:44:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks for the patch - I'm starting to get a better understanding of doing stuff like this as I see more examples, so I'm thinking a little differently from when I wrote the bug report

On lock_path ...

It definitely is something a sysadmin or distributor might want to change ... so it's valid to have that as a config option. There's no need point in making each project define this option for themselves.

lock_path also is something which needs to be different for each project - i.e. each project might be running as a different user, so you want it to be e.g. /var/lib/nova for nova. The set_defaults API is perfect for this

However, you could also imagine users of this API who want to be explicit about the lock path rather than relying on the default ... so I think it's sane for this to be a function argument which falls back to the config option if not explicitly passed

On lock_file_prefix ....

It makes sense for each project to use a different prefix, in the case where the project is sharing a dir with another project

However, it doesn't need to be something configurable - why would a user want to change it?

The function argument seems like the right thing to support here, but maybe we could provide a convenience API like:

  def synchronized_with_prefix(lock_file_prefix):
      return functools.partial(synchronized, lock_file_prefix=lock_file_prefix)

and then nova would do something like this in e.g. nova/utils.py:

  from nova.openstack.common import lockutils

  synchronized = lockutils.synchronized_with_prefix('nova-')"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-07 10:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (4 inline comments)

commit_message:
Added convenience APIs for lockutils

The lock_file_prefix for each project doesn't need to be configurable or
frequently changed. This patch provides a convenience API which returns
a partial object of the synchronized decorator to avoid passing the prefix
each time locks are used.

The set_defaults method is also provided to change the default value of
lock_path when needed.

Fixes bug #1065524

Change-Id: I7b67f0a482da4be6d53a70db5bbd22dc91bdc10c

commit_message:
Stylistic improvements from quantum-rootwrap

As part of the convergence effort between oslo-rootwrap and
quantum-rootwrap, import stylistic improvements introduced
in quantum-rootwrap, like:

- HACKING-compliant docstrings
- More elegant return construct from match_filter in filters.py
- Remove overridden use of filters in wrapper.py

Change-Id: I49a97271b1c385feb25adf4f62add5c71962b5dd

commit_message:
Log a warning if dnsmasq version is below the minimum required

It has been noted that older versions of dnsmasq may have unexpected
behavior, so this patch introduces a check on dnsmasq version; if
the minimum version is not met, a warning is logged. This is less
invasive than raising an Exception and abort the dhcp agent, even
though this also seems like a perfectly acceptable behavior.

Fixes bug 1170793

Change-Id: Idd91c3753fb05f223ed0e3c53ad692ee65ea4905

commit_message:
Disable eventlet monkey-patching of DNS

This change avoids eventlet's monkey-patching of DNS
resolution. eventlet's doesn't support IPv6, for example.

The way to avoid eventlet's DNS is to set an environment
variable. The trick is the environment variable needs to be set
before eventlet is imported.

A similar change was made in nova, so this is just copying
that code and technique to keystone.

This allows re-enabling the IPv6 tests, too.

Change-Id: I30524a1cebd43580d692fd88ef32be45e62758c5

commit_message:
Change variable name of admin_state_down to admin_state

It is confusing that admin_state_down=False means admin-state is DOWN.
It is easy to understand if the variable name matches its value.

Also removes 'default=xxx' from options with store_true/false action
since store_true/false sets the default value implicitly.

Fixes bug 1161853

Change-Id: I3146dd8974990c94e5f9b3b5bf6a8b28a245d64e

Currently this requires admin, the same as the other API

blueprint meter-post-api

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-08 14:27:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix zookeeper import and tests

Import zookeeper.membership rather than zookeeper.membersip.
Also fixed some issues with setting up the tests for the zookeeper
servicegroup driver.  Config options were not being set before
initializing the driver leading to failures.

There is no added test for this because the bug is indistinguishable
from not having the zookeeper python modules installed, which leads to
skipping these servicegroup tests.

Bug 1177776

Change-Id: Idd6dca2e03169399b930cc1fc1a85636497cb0b5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix zookeeper import and tests

Import zookeeper.membership rather than zookeeper.membersip.
Also fixed some issues with setting up the tests for the zookeeper
servicegroup driver.  Config options were not being set before
initializing the driver leading to failures.

There is no added test for this because the bug is indistinguishable
from not having the zookeeper python modules installed, which leads to
skipping these servicegroup tests.

Bug 1177776

Change-Id: Idd6dca2e03169399b930cc1fc1a85636497cb0b5

commit_message:
Check shared storage when doing instance resize

The live migration does useful check on shared storage,
and resize should do the same

Fix bug 1172832

Change-Id: I1d6034342749b4576ba8f447e69c58106e154653

messages:
[{'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-05-02 04:12:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

See comment inline."}, {'account_id': 6369, 'date': '2013-05-02 16:31:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Michael,

  The PowerVM exception is in fact the exception type which is thrown by VirtualPowerManager.
  VirtualPowerManager in trunk currently uses some of the PowerVM code for ssh things:
 https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/baremetal/virtual_power_driver.py#L30

  Whether or not VirtualPowerManager should be depending on PowerVM ssh code is a good question.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-10 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 21:48:12.000000000', 'message': 'Log a helpful error when VirtualPowerManager fails.

Before, if VirtualPowerManager failed to connect to its
ssh host, the error which appeared in the log was this:
  "Instance bmtest found in the hypervisor, but not in the database"

This change causes a more specific error to be logged,
while retaining the behavior that nova-compute fails to
start if it cannot determine the power state of the baremetal
nodes it manages.

Bug: 1168610
Change-Id: I5ce2d8e8e5843340831f999870e203650f9d16d7
'}]
commit_message:
Log a helpful error when VirtualPowerManager fails.

Before, if VirtualPowerManager failed to connect to its
ssh host, the error which appeared in the log was this:
  "Instance bmtest found in the hypervisor, but not in the database"

This change causes a more specific error to be logged,
while retaining the behavior that nova-compute fails to
start if it cannot determine the power state of the baremetal
nodes it manages.

Bug: 1168610

commit_message:
Fix runnning first-boot.d scripts on fedora startup

The fedora rc-local service will look for /etc/rc.d/rc.local instead
of /etc/rc.local. So now we are going to check what OS is the image
and if it's a fedora image we are going to create the rc.local in the
appropriate directory.

Change-Id: I6762e31b86c1b8a33d4e93dba6f7a2b3808d4b04

[{'created': '2013-05-10 06:03:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for break=all.

If $break contains "all", every possible breakpoint will be triggered.
This is a lot of breakpoints, so it is likely only a debugging option of
last resort.

Change-Id: Ia4f3e080697647c615a2437d0cfd5a13c499eac2
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for break=all.

If $break contains "all", every possible breakpoint will be triggered.
This is a lot of breakpoints, so it is likely only a debugging option of
last resort.

Change-Id: Ia4f3e080697647c615a2437d0cfd5a13c499eac2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-24 17:03:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove skips in test_images_oneserver

* Remove this test case test_create_image_specify_multibyte_character_image_name

  This test case doesn't make sense as the snapshot name provided is a string
  and string can include any characters.
  In this test case, the snapshot_name passed is a valid string and a snapshot is
  successfully created. This is a negative test and it expects this operation to
  fail and hence this test case doesn't make sense"

Fixes bug 1006725

Change-Id: I18943d27e7643714f6c013cf13fd3d15b7f9efec
'}]
commit_message:
Remove skips in test_images_oneserver

* Remove this test case test_create_image_specify_multibyte_character_image_name

  This test case doesn't make sense as the snapshot name provided is a string
  and string can include any characters.
  In this test case, the snapshot_name passed is a valid string and a snapshot is
  successfully created. This is a negative test and it expects this operation to
  fail and hence this test case doesn't make sense"

Fixes bug 1006725

Change-Id: I18943d27e7643714f6c013cf13fd3d15b7f9efec

commit_message:
Set default fixed_ip quota to unlimited.

DocImpact: our previous default quota of ten was poorly thought through
and resulted in upgrade problems. Instead, let's have operators opt into
fixed IP quotas. This change should be mentioned in release notes please.

Resolves bug 1161190.

Change-Id: I32b3e3a9af7f94bda58a9a012cbe863d3abc0ca2

commit_message:
Improve test coverage for quantumclient.common.serializer module

OpenStack quantumclient.common.serializer package includes
a lot of components not covered with unit tests.

Add unittests for the following classes:
* Serializer
* XMLDictSerializer
* ActionDispatcher
* XMLDeserializer
* JSONDeserializer
* DictSerializer
* JSONDictSerializer
* TextDeserialize

Implements: blueprint quantumclient-serializer-unittests
Change-Id: Ifb7cffc13ecc812ac6dd57cc27d13dde968c88f8

subject: Doubling the ring
messages:
[{'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-02-13 16:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-13 17:19:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

You know, I submitted a very similar patch around a year ago, and gholt very kindly explained to me why my patch, your patch, and all the similar patches he'd seen don't work. I can't find the actual Gerrit review anywhere, though, so I can't quote him directly. Instead, I'll paraphrase:

The on-disk path of an account, container, or object contains the partition number as one of the directories. By changing the ring's part_power, you change the partition that each account/container/object is in. While it is true that everything will still map to the same devices, the on-disk paths no longer match, so this won't work.

Alright, paraphrase over. I hope I didn't mangle his words too terribly.

Here's a couple places to go take a look at to see exactly what the on-disk path for an object is:

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/obj/server.py#L117

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/utils.py#L923

Personally, I'd love to see the ability to change a ring's part_power without data loss, so please don't let me discourage you from continuing to think about this."}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-02-13 19:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Here is a link to the one year old work Sam was referring to with the text from gholt.  
https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/933803

We can consider this to be the yearly event in which we try to crack the part_power problem. 

Driving home, I had an idea how this can be done by decoupling the partiton number of the two sides. Not sure if this will solve everything (or even anything) but will dive into the details and see if something good can come up.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-13 19:42:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Seems I must post a 0 to clear my -2, no matter how many additional patch sets are uploaded. I haven't had a chance to review the code yet, but I don't want to be holding things up either."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-27 21:48:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (3 inline comments)

I'm trying to understand how replication works in this new world, and I'm having a little trouble getting it all straight in my head.

Let's say there's an object replicator on box A that's going to replicate partition 2468. Partition 2468 resides on sdc, and that's in the ring with part_power 16.

The destination for partition 2468 is box B's sdj drive, which is in the ring with part_power 15. I think this means that the destination for all this stuff on box B would be partition 1234. How does the replicator know to put stuff into that partition?

Conversely, if a replicator on B is replicating partition 1234 off of sdj (part_power 15) and it's replicating to box A's sdc (part_power 15), then how does it know what goes into A's partition 2467 and what goes into 2468? The part_power shrinking would map both 2467 and 2468 into the old, smaller 1234, so there's got to be some mechanism (I think) for splitting that stuff up.

Any chance you could show a couple examples to help me (or other reviewers) out?"}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-02-28 09:03:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sam and all,  

Here is more details about the replicator design + example:
1.	Object replicators communicate with REPLICATE while using the language of the current ring part_power. 
2.	Object replicators also calculate and store the hash of suffixes using the language of the current ring part_power. This allows two object replicators to compare hash suffixes efficiently. 
3.	Object replicators store local objects within a device in a directory based on the device part_power. 
4.	rsync violates the autonomy of the servers as it allows one server to address a path of the other. To overcome this, the local Object replicator uses the destination device part_power to calculate the path within the destination device.

Example in which an object replicator is running on Server A. 
Lets assume sdb1 on Server A has part_power of 8 and sdb2 on Server B has a part power of 9. 
Lets also assume that the current ring has a part_power of 10.

Lets consider partition number 50 of the current ring.
In sdb1:
-	This partition is stored at path: /srv/node/sdb1/objects/12/
-	The hash suffix file looks like:
{'ring_part_power': 10, 
  'hash_parts': {48: {s:h,s:h…}, 49: {s:h…}, 50: {s:h…}, 51: {s:h…}}}  
In sdb2:
-	This partition is stored at path: /srv/node/sdb2/objects/25/  
-	The hash suffix file looks like:
{'ring_part_power': 10, 
  'hash_parts': {50: {s:h…}, 51: {s:h…}}}  
s: is representing a suffix
h: is representing a suffix hash

So when server A is processing /srv/node/sdb1/objects/12/ it collects 4 jobs for the respective ring partitions: 48, 49, 50 and 51.
When server A processes the job for ring partition 50, it will send a REPLICATE request to Server B while using:
        REPLICATE /sbd2/50/s-s-s-s

When Server A rsyncs to Server B it should use:
        rsync \
            /srv/node/sdb1/objects/12/s/object_hash/object_filename \ 
            /srv/node/sdb2/objects/25/s/object_hash/object_filename  

Note that Servers A and B can always calculate the partition numbers of their counter devices and of the ring since they all know the object_hash and the part_power used by the other party. The function that does this is:
      key_to_part(hsh, part_power)

(btw I just noticed I left out the key_to_part thingy at the rsync and will be sending a new patch set to correct)"}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-02-28 12:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

It appears that the required change in the rsync would lead to either rsyncing to many objects (resulting in replicating objects that we should not) or rsynching in the granularity of a single object which may affect performance. 

We can start with a solution that rsyncs in the granularity of a single object (only after a ring doubling event to not effect existing installations) and than improve by enhancing the replicator to rsync (or even PUT) only the objects that actually needs to be rsynced instead of complete suffixes - which is a waste even today. 

(Btw, and before I am being yelled at - there seem to be no way for me to make this into a draft in the interim time)'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-02-28 15:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 16:26:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

This probably lands in the "my personal opinion" department, but I'd rather not see this land until after rsync is cleared away, hashes.pkl is replaced, and other replication speed/efficiency improvements occur.

I do want the ability to change the ring size after a cluster launch; I just think it's lower priority than optimizing replication. And I think the optimization could make implementing doubling easier down the road. Certainly doing it in that order would mean it wouldn't have to be implemented twice. ;)'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-03-18 20:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-13 16:29:56.000000000', 'message': 'Doubling the ring

This patch is a bold attempt to help get rid of the necessity
to define in advance the part_power.
Instead it aims to allow an admin to start with a smaller
part_power and grow the part power without changing the
placement of data.

Remark:
Only initial testing performed so far

Change-Id: Icfe39d6c7a764ff976730c5819d579aef41efaab
'}, {'created': '2013-02-13 16:34:14.000000000', 'message': 'Doubling the ring

This patch is a bold attempt to help get rid of the necessity
to define in advance the part_power.
Instead it aims to allow an admin to start with a smaller
part_power and grow the part power without changing the
placement of data.

Remark:
Only initial testing performed so far

Change-Id: Icfe39d6c7a764ff976730c5819d579aef41efaab
'}, {'created': '2013-02-14 00:46:48.000000000', 'message': 'Doubling the ring

This patch is a bold attempt to help get rid of the necessity
to define in advance the part_power.
Instead it aims to allow an admin to start with a smaller
part_power and grow the part power without changing the
placement of data.

This partial work is commited to allow review and brainstorming

The basic idea behind this patch is as follows:
* A server can be configured to run with a given (private) part_power.

* If a server is not configured to run with a part_power it should
behave as it did before the patch (and ring doubling is not supported)

* If a server is configreud to  run with a part_power, it will
maintain this part_power even if the ring part_power changes
such that the (private) part_power is never changed.

* Any server with a configured (private) part_power will ignore
the partition sent by a client sender (e.g. the proxy or the replicator).
Instead, it will calculate its partition based on other date sent
with the request while utilizing its (private) part_power.

Any request incoming from the proxy includes the path:
     - the server can therefore caluclate its partition using the path
Any request incoming from the replicator (should) include the key:
     - the server can caluclate the partition from the key
       (This seem to work for account and container, TBD for obj)

Remark:
Only initial testing performed so far

Change-Id: Icfe39d6c7a764ff976730c5819d579aef41efaab
'}, {'created': '2013-02-19 19:02:49.000000000', 'message': "Doubling the ring

This patch adds support for ring size changes.
More specifically it allows to increase (but not decrease)
the ring by doubling every partition.

Doubling the ring changes the partition numbers meaning that
it may affect the directory structure of the a/c/o servers.
To overcome this, the patch includes the following additional
changes:
* The ring now holds a part_power per device which will never be changed.
* The storage_directory was changed to offer a stable path based on the
the device part_power
* The db_replicators were adjusted such that they find nodes based on
the hash used as part of the db path
* The object replicators were adjusted to hold multiple hash lists
per HASH FILE
* The object REPLICATE was extended to include a new header
carrying the sender's ring part_power.

This patch is fully backwards compatible.
The only change made to an existing installation is progressing the
HASH FILE to a new format without rehashing of objects.

The patch supports gradually upgrading existing installations to become
ready for a future ring doubling event.

Implements: blueprint ring-doubling
Change-Id: Icfe39d6c7a764ff976730c5819d579aef41efaab
"}, {'created': '2013-02-21 10:12:43.000000000', 'message': "Doubling the ring

commit_message:
Doubling the ring

This patch adds support for ring size changes.
More specifically it allows to increase (but not decrease)
the ring by doubling every partition.

Doubling the ring changes the partition numbers meaning that
it may affect the directory structure of the a/c/o servers.
To overcome this, the patch includes the following additional
changes:
* The ring now holds a part_power per device which will never be changed.
* The storage_directory was changed to offer a stable path based on the
the device part_power
* The db_replicators were adjusted such that they find nodes based on
the hash used as part of the db path
* The object replicators were adjusted to hold multiple hash lists
per HASH FILE
* The object REPLICATE was extended to include a new header
carrying the sender's ring part_power.

This patch is fully backwards compatible.
The only change made to an existing installation is progressing the
HASH FILE to a new format without rehashing of objects.

The patch supports gradually upgrading existing installations to become
ready for a future ring doubling event.

Implements: blueprint ring-doubling
Change-Id: Icfe39d6c7a764ff976730c5819d579aef41efaab

commit_message:
Changes the server manifest

This patch changes the server.pp manifest:

  * Adds a doc header
  * Sets auth_password to false so noauth can be used
  * Wraps the auth stuff into a conditional block so noauth can be used
  * Formatting cleanup

Change-Id: Ia6e4522c5b45c5c4b59becae70d7468757a79f6a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-03 19:15:31.000000000', 'message': 'Adds --addn-hosts to the dnsmasq arg list

When using multi_host=True and update_dns_entries=True, dns records from
other compute hosts were not able to be resolved.  The --addn-host arg was
constructed but not appended to the cmd list.

Change-Id: I9cafb59256e92bdad0df3e9166e0afd079ae0c09
Fixes: bug #1170529
(cherry picked from commit 3922da72b2569976f25183c476cedcc17d32fa13)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds --addn-hosts to the dnsmasq arg list

When using multi_host=True and update_dns_entries=True, dns records from
other compute hosts were not able to be resolved.  The --addn-host arg was
constructed but not appended to the cmd list.

Change-Id: I9cafb59256e92bdad0df3e9166e0afd079ae0c09
Fixes: bug #1170529
(cherry picked from commit 3922da72b2569976f25183c476cedcc17d32fa13)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-06 15:15:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix EC2 instance bdm response

Make the bdm response respect Amazon EC2 spec:
 * use ec2 volume id instead of uuid
 * use volume attach_status instead of status

References:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-ItemType-EbsInstanceBlockDeviceMappingResponseType.html

Resolves bug 1165973.

Change-Id: Ib68397b79f63e01e92ed4bebbc245ba5e0a3ad11
(cherry picked from commit f48a2e1a68cca1ef147279b2ddf713635f494bc0)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix EC2 instance bdm response

Make the bdm response respect Amazon EC2 spec:
 * use ec2 volume id instead of uuid
 * use volume attach_status instead of status

References:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-ItemType-EbsInstanceBlockDeviceMappingResponseType.html

Resolves bug 1165973.

Change-Id: Ib68397b79f63e01e92ed4bebbc245ba5e0a3ad11
(cherry picked from commit f48a2e1a68cca1ef147279b2ddf713635f494bc0)

Is this patch still in WIP? if not, I don't see the code logic which verify the compatibility before migration, if the verify logic is just a if new_root_gb < curr_root_gb:, I don't see in what circumstances that resizing from big to small will happen, or we will never allow resizing from big to small, in this case it will be better to do this check in the resize api rather than in driver, because the user experience is not good, since the resize from big to small will fail anyway.

BTW: why you don't use disk.can_resize_fs API, from my point of view we should use same api to keep consistency. thanks."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-05-08 07:37:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This patch doesn't support for resizes to smaller sizes and that won't happen at least until we have a guest agent that will resize the guest FS first. Please see the commit message.

This patch is needed only to avoid starting a useless migration that will be aborted during finish_migration, leaving the instance in a hardly recoverable state.

There's no need to change the resize API. What we need here is that manager.py returns an error without having the VM set in ERROR state, but that's the subject of a separate discussion / bug / patch.

The "disk.can_resize_fs" is a private Linux only API, it doesn't work on Hyper-V. 

Guest FS resize is a responsibility of the guest, at the Hypervisor level, we will resize the VHD to a smaller size only after the FS has been shrinked first.'}, {'account_id': 7040, 'date': '2013-05-08 12:06:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: No score

Hi Alessandro, thanks for your quick response, I noticed you modified the commit message, and it looks better now, the previous commit message will get people confused.

Let's leave the question that how to fix this issue for now, the question in my previous comments still valid, if the hypervisor doesn't support the resizing from big to small for now, why we should let user do it? we already know it will fail anyway, throw the exception and vm get error state will damage the user experience. so the rollback mechanism might be needed here, I agree that it can be deal with in a separate patch.

Another suggestion, we need to modify the documentation like this https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/HypervisorSupportMatrix to point out clearly that resizing operation has a limitation for now.

Anyway, this patch is still a progress so far, thanks."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-05-08 14:41:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Alessandro, could you get a docs defect opened for putting an asterisk in the Resize cell for the Hyper-V column here as Guo Hui pointed out?

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/HypervisorSupportMatrix

Then reference that back here (or in bug 1163844) so we don't lose track of it?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-05-09 18:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-05-09 23:30:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-10 00:48:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

commit_message:
Adds instance root disk size checks during resize

Fixes bug: #1163844

The Hyper-V driver does not support disk resizes to a smaller size.
This patch verifies the disk size compatibility before the migration
starts in order to avoid data losses.

Change-Id: Ie99bf8779d583e97b911c9a136cee1bca9a1ecdc

commit_message:
Use updated metadata location for nova.baremetal.arch.

boot-stack was looking for a config value in the metadata
at 'nova.bm_arch', but it was recently moved to 'nova.baremetal.arch'.

Change-Id: I93447a6fa1d9be0b3278393141ab207a840ee6d8

Thanks for all of your great work all the time Monty. Just one thing.

We also need to update run_tests.sh to use flake8 instead of pep8. Although, I wouldn't mind getting rid of run_tests soon but that's a whole different story."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-04-22 18:32:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Could the commit message have a sentence or two about why this change is being made?"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-04-24 18:15:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Alex: why remove ./run_tests.sh? I'm still using that to run individual files / test cases. . . am I just behind the times?"}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-04-24 18:22:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Mark: I was just passive aggressively saying we should have a single test runner.

But my main point is if we remove pep8 from test-requires then run_tests.sh shouldn't use pep8 and should run flake8 to be consistent."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-04-26 12:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@mark FWIW, I use tox (since we have tox.ini) instead of run_tests. It does everything run_tests does and I can specify the envs to test.

If you use tox you can tell it to run specific tests like this:

tox -epy27 -- glance/tests/unit/....py 

Everything after -- will be passed to nosetest.

Hope that helps!'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-04-27 10:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-04-27 10:15:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Use webtest for tests and reorganise.

Replace starting an eventlet server for every API call with webtest
requests. The intention for the moment is not to increase speed but to
limit the dependency of our tests on eventlet. Currently the client/ and
server/ tests are the only ones running against an active server.

Group related API tests into modules.

The naming structure I've tried for is:
    tests/{name}/ - A group of related tests for a component.
    tests/{name}/base_{name}.py - Common functionality for tests.
    tests/{name}/{str}_tests.py - A group of tests related to {str} that
        aren't runnable but should be included in specific backend test cases.
    tests/{name}/test_{str}.py - A set of runnable test cases for target {str}.

In writing tests the primary change for API tests is that the
response.body is now the string body and response.result is the parsed
dictionary. This is a restriction of webob/webtest.

Change-Id: I059ddf2a26fd5f072ced70faf516185b8e51184c

When partition tables are added to loopback devices, this can set off a
chain of udev hooks that may still be holding the loopback open. Failing

commit_message:
Retry losetup -d for up to 10 seconds.

When partition tables are added to loopback devices, this can set off a
chain of udev hooks that may still be holding the loopback open. Failing
to detach loopback devices was the reason we were seeing leaked tmpfs
volumes.

Fixes bug #1178091

Change-Id: I836d6e2bbce824951dd4786e3ef28273ea18ee73

'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-05-07 22:31:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Just so I'm clear, does the dependency on the new api prevent someone from running on current/previous XS releases? Will it fail gracefully?"}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-05-07 22:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

It checks that the new functionality is available using a XAPI plugin and yes, it will fail gracefully - the live migrate will fail and the VM remains in a running state on the source.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-05-07 22:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I mean, right now we can live migrate on top of current/legacy releases of XS, right? Does this change make it fail (gracefully) in the absence of this unreleased new API? I.e. are we losing functionality?'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-05-08 06:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Ah - no.  Live migration with an iscsi volume attached does not work without this patch, and only works with this patch + different xapi.  Live migration without an iscsi volume works with or without this patch and with or without the different xapi.  No loss of functionality at all.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-08 07:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Dan: This is different than... live migration where the boot disk is iSCSI... which I believe worked before and still works.  This implements live migration of local disk that also happens to have an iSCSI attachment... which never worked.

Bob: Did I get it right?  (Just wanted to clarify this is different than the boot-from-volume case)'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-05-08 07:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I haven't tested the iscsi boot disk scenario - but my understanding was that live migration didn't work and we needed a further change to make it work.

Either way - this change definitely won't regress that functionality as it is only a way to say a volume need not be mirrored by XSM.  It is very possible that BFV with iscsi is fixed with this patch.

Further testing is needed for that, and we are planning to look at it soon."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-08 18:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Ah ok.  I had thought the traditional shared-storage live migration worked before.  Maybe not ;)'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-09 21:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-09 21:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: No score

Draft fix for bug 1160323.

Depends on internal XAPI commit 11de810d740cc08946e90752e86728a6e98574eb
with commit message CP-4498: Added relaxed check mode to allow
iSCSI SRs during XSM.

It also depends on a configuration change which must be documented and added to devstack:
* Set "relax-xsm-sr-check = true" in /etc/xapi.conf

This commit makes the following changes:
* Attach the SR on the destination host prior to migrate
* Returns the SR-ref from the pre_migrate call (API change)
* Populates the XS VDI map with the sr-ref on the destination host
* Removes the connection to the SR from the source host post-migrate

commit_message:
Enable live block migration when using iSCSI volumes

Fix for bug 1160323.

DocImpact
Depends on a version of XAPI supporting relax-xsm-sr-check.
Currently no release versions support this, so the change at
https://github.com/xen-org/xen-api/pull/1116 would need to be applied
to the source to enable this.  XenServer 6.2 is expected to
support this mode, and possibly some future hotfixes for XenServer 6.1.

It also depends on a configuration change which must be documented and added to devstack:
* Set "relax-xsm-sr-check = true" in /etc/xapi.conf

This commit makes the following changes:
* Attach the SR on the destination host prior to migrate
* Returns the SR-ref from the pre_migrate call (API change)
* Populates the XS VDI map with the sr-ref on the destination host
* Removes the connection to the SR from the source host post-migrate
* Added plugin to determine if iSCSI block migration is enabled

Associated tempest test at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26478/

Change-Id: I917d9cf094190d636f4b9e14f6c8e728ff85af0e
Fixes: bug 1160323

commit_message:
Allow empty configuration value

Some Nova configurations allows an empty value. In some case,
an empty string needs to be explicitly set otherwise
the default value is used. (such as dhcp_domain)

Change-Id: I410f981ec6976f9bb4e5877cc14730d17ff4225b

commit_message:
Rename nova_config rspec tests

The unit tests got updated when we changed nova_config provider
from parsed to ini_settings, but we forgot to rename the file.
Renaming it to better reflect which provider is tested.

Change-Id: Ib3c0581b589e01db804ffba54c7faf7f329ce844

commit_message:
Fixes KeyError bug with network api associate

Fixes bug in network api associate function where it would always
raise a KeyError when associating or disassociating a project.

Fixes bug 1171284

Change-Id: Iae0e57e0a961b8a3377b38dad72094188755a3e8

subject: Record smoketest dependency on gFlags
messages:
[{'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-04-30 22:08:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The commit message could be better (https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages) [reason for -1]

in the past we have used test-requires for the unit tests and not the smoketests.  If we are keeping the smoke tests around I would rather see us move away from the gflags dependency all together."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-04-30 22:27:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Joe:

Yeah, I'm not sure about the status of smoketests, but I agree, if we do keep them around, Havana would be a good time to move away from gFlags towards openstack.common.cfg.

Still, in the short-term, thought it would be a good idea to record that dependency somwhere, whether it is test-requires or a newly created smoketest-requires."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-04-30 22:30:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-04-30 22:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Record smoketest dependency on gFlags

The smoketests currently have a dependency on gFlags. Long term, this should
be converted to use openstack.common.cfg; but in the near term, we should
record this existing dependency.

Fixes bug 1174953

Change-Id: I465abc6a4a2e8f7ebd1fe70ad239c760960a82ed

commit_message:
Add pbr to devstack.

It's being used in all of the core projects, so we should install it
at the start so we can ensure that we don't break everything all at
once.

Change-Id: I326d724264803e88315ee9e40f4634836baf6e0b

commit_message:
Remove cinder-config element.

Make cinder consistent with other OpenStack service
elements by moving cinder-config into a subdirectory
of cinder.

Change-Id: I9497062226b43fc386c02f9210029b86d4237796

commit_message:
Ensure default flavor is set when upgrading tempest

Add DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE to upgrade tempest to ensure this is
set. This avoids recreation of existing flavors when upgrading
tempest.

Change-Id: If2e872132939faa4b8afc8dc9b7d7d9aeb026c96
Fix: Bug 1178028

commit_message:
Fix setup-grenade to pass user and host as parameter

setup-grenade was not working when defining a different username/host
when running ./setup-grenade <host> [<user>].

Change-Id: Ie9590878dafbdd2e3ff8b2d9779be6cdefe671b6

actually useful.

commit_message:
Create a common function for method _parse_network_vlan_ranges used
by plugins.

The _parse_network_vlan_ranges method does the same thing for the
linuxbridge, ovs, and hyperv plugins. Create a common function for
the plugins to use instead. This paves the way for improving vlan
range verification (see #1169266) in one place.

Fixes Bug #1177428

Change-Id: Ie8c20807e9146dd9c8bc011dd3a4dc10ec871e0b

commit_message:
Correct network config for boot-stack quantum.

The default gateway for a network has to be on the same subnet as the
network. Fix bug 1178117

Change-Id: Idd9d34442d827eab7373278d65dc74ceb2a39cd1

commit_message:
install python-netaddr before running get_default_host_ip

python-netaddr may not be installed on a system so we need to install it
before we use get_default_host_ip

Change-Id: I6a76d24c4385bf00f1c5991ca0704b2ba1609d0c

commit_message:
Fetch routers ports for metadata access from DB

Bug 1176963

There is no need to retrieve the ports from the NVP backend, so
a DB query will be enough.

Change-Id: If3529cc5694434e8cdc9d21a4043f94212146d2d

commit_message:
Improve checking of return values for functions in linuxbridge agent plugin

Fixes bug 1167780

Changed return values for some ensure_* functions to make them more consistent.
Now all ensure_* functions return None on failure and return the entity that was
created within the function when successful. Made changes to the unit tests to
reflect the changed return values.

Change-Id: Ib015ee7cee50bae5d91a4e109e7381519c1e14f7

commit_message:
Change type of cells.deleted from boolean to integer.

Fixes bug #1168490

Migration 152 changed other tables' deleted column from boolean
to integer, but cells got missed.  SQLite and MySQL are weakly-
typed enough that mixing integers and booleans is allowed, but
PostgreSQL is not, and this causes an error.

Migration 179 is a copy of migration 152, except applied only to
the cells table.

Change-Id: I85c39765edc206d38d21827ab54e1371155b9557

commit_message:
Allow missing tags in templates.

Previously missing_tags was set to 'strict', so any missing values in
the configuration json would be flagged as an error. They will now be
ignored and returned as u'', per the pystache documentation.

Change-Id: I46d675bdd76948238191be92f0a2162963fcc478

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-09 16:32:11.000000000', 'message': "Allow secure user password update.

This patch allows the ability for user password to be updated via a command prompt so the password doesnt show up in the bash history. The prompted password is asked twice to verify the match. If user cntl-D's the prompt a message appears suggesting user to use either of the options to update the password.

Change-Id: I439604f9c858aa022607e22d32a24cc6b99d42dd
Fixes: bug#938315
"}]
commit_message:
Allow secure user password update.

This patch allows the ability for user password to be updated via a command prompt so the password doesnt show up in the bash history. The prompted password is asked twice to verify the match. If user cntl-D's the prompt a message appears suggesting user to use either of the options to update the password.

Change-Id: I439604f9c858aa022607e22d32a24cc6b99d42dd
Fixes: bug#938315

[{'created': '2013-05-09 18:18:00.000000000', 'message': 'Adds metadata_listen parameter

Previously, metadata_listen used the api_bind_address
parameter, but there are scenarios when it should listen on another
IP address, such as localhost - for example, when using Quantum
metadata.

Change-Id: I8b1b2d8623a0626516342f7750eecb3087e8a880
'}]
commit_message:
Adds metadata_listen parameter

Previously, metadata_listen used the api_bind_address
parameter, but there are scenarios when it should listen on another
IP address, such as localhost - for example, when using Quantum
metadata.

Change-Id: I8b1b2d8623a0626516342f7750eecb3087e8a880

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-09 17:53:09.000000000', 'message': "Controller and API changes for backups.

-API controller for backups
-adding swift url to the config
-Fixing failing tests
-Renaming 'instance' param.
 Checking for NotFound models so that the returned error is friendly
-adding feature to list all backups from a specific instance
-Adding checks for creating/deleting/restoring backups when it is not completed
-Adding unit tests for backup controller
-adding check to see if file is in swift
-Adding skeleton code for delete backup in the task manager
-Fixed backups API to pass in the backup_id during create_backup.
-adding int tests for backup controller
-Adding backup list and delete int tests
-Adding list backups for instance test
-Adding quota for create backup

commit_message:
Controller and API changes for backups.

-API controller for backups
-adding swift url to the config
-Fixing failing tests
-Renaming 'instance' param.
 Checking for NotFound models so that the returned error is friendly
-adding feature to list all backups from a specific instance
-Adding checks for creating/deleting/restoring backups when it is not completed
-Adding unit tests for backup controller
-adding check to see if file is in swift
-Adding skeleton code for delete backup in the task manager
-Fixed backups API to pass in the backup_id during create_backup.
-adding int tests for backup controller
-Adding backup list and delete int tests
-Adding list backups for instance test
-Adding quota for create backup

BP: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/reddwarf/+spec/consistent-snapshots

Change-Id: I35c2fefcce4b3009e76ba7232c52dabf502a3ac0

Why duplicate all the apts hierarchy just for one line ?

=== 8< ==================
diff -Naur apts-ubuntu/n-cpu apts-debian/n-cpu
--- apts-ubuntu/n-cpu	2013-05-06 09:51:27.486222239 +0200
+++ apts-debian/n-cpu	2013-05-06 09:51:27.486222239 +0200
@@ -2,7 +2,6 @@
 nbd-client
 lvm2
 open-iscsi
-open-iscsi-utils
 genisoimage
 sysfsutils
 sg3-utils
=== 8< ==================

Just change the open-iscsi-utils line to:
=== 8< ==================

subject: Adds Block Storage (cinder) install to install and deploy guide.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-03 19:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/1196/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS in 00:01:40
- http://logs.openstack.org/28189/1/check/gate-openstack-operations-guide/509 : SUCCESS in 00:02:49
- http://logs.openstack.org/28189/1/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/745 : SUCCESS in 00:00:16
'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-05-07 00:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 7042, 'date': '2013-05-07 08:13:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The nova.conf is not optimal.
The default for 'volume_api_class' is 'nova.volume.cinder.API' since Grizzly so this line is not needed anymore.
I think the 'volume_driver' is supposed to be in Cinder.
'volume_group=cinder-volumes', 'volume_name_template=volume-%s' and 'iscsi_helper=tgtadm' belongs to the cinder configuration file.
The 'enabled_apis' reflects the default value since Grizzly."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:26:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the input, I'm patching. There's a note that says this in the Block Storage book:

#Leaving out enabled_apis altogether is NOT sufficient, as it defaults to include osapi_volume

which prompted me to put in enabled_apis."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/1231/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS in 00:01:56
- http://logs.openstack.org/28189/2/check/gate-openstack-operations-guide/544 : SUCCESS in 00:03:04
- http://logs.openstack.org/28189/2/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/780 : SUCCESS in 00:00:06
'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-05-07 19:10:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Anne:

I believe that enabled_apis default changed from folsom to grizzly. In grizzly, enabled_apis defaults to ec2,asapi_compute,metadata. It doesn't contain osapi_volume anymore."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-05-08 19:46:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-08 19:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/1267/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS in 00:01:23
- http://logs.openstack.org/28189/3/check/gate-openstack-operations-guide/580 : SUCCESS in 00:02:28
- http://logs.openstack.org/28189/3/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/816 : SUCCESS in 00:00:04
'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-05-08 19:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-08 20:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-05-09 16:45:05.000000000', 'message': 'in dhcp_agent, always use quantum.conf root_helper

Fixes bug #1178003.

For the most part, the dhcp agent uses the root_helper setting from the [AGENT]
section of /etc/quantum/quantum.conf. However, in a couple of spots, the
root_helper setting from the [DEFAULT] section of /etc/quantum/dhcp_agent.ini
was being used.

Change-Id: Id2f3140374a705cf7a0d2a784e4f321cc54f602e
'}]
commit_message:
in dhcp_agent, always use quantum.conf root_helper

Fixes bug #1178003.

For the most part, the dhcp agent uses the root_helper setting from the [AGENT]
section of /etc/quantum/quantum.conf. However, in a couple of spots, the
root_helper setting from the [DEFAULT] section of /etc/quantum/dhcp_agent.ini
was being used.

Change-Id: Id2f3140374a705cf7a0d2a784e4f321cc54f602e

[{'created': '2013-05-08 10:49:02.000000000', 'message': "Set MYSQL_HOST parameter to better support multi-node mode.

When deploying openstack with multi-node mode,
mysql needs to be started by listening it's real ip, not localhost.
but devstack always use localhost to recreate databases that will
lead bellow errors.

Fix bug 1177735

Change-Id: I50284f469a998d023a41b4796f1dc775bb52e710
"}]
commit_message:
Set MYSQL_HOST parameter to better support multi-node mode.

When deploying openstack with multi-node mode,
mysql needs to be started by listening it's real ip, not localhost.
but devstack always use localhost to recreate databases that will
lead bellow errors.

Fix bug 1177735

Change-Id: I50284f469a998d023a41b4796f1dc775bb52e710

commit_message:
Update the package name of qpid in the fedora platform

The package name of qpid in default yum repository
is qpid-cpp-server, not qpid-cpp-server-daemon.

Fix bug 1177731

Change-Id: I4412029966583f5ef5a5a4cc80e7fdc4771c8eca

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-06 17:45:38.000000000', 'message': "Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7

Fixes bug 1158828

Even though SQLAlchemy is documented to support foreign keys (with
the pragma set) on SQLite >= 3.6.19, we're seeing consistent problems
with that support on RHEL 6.4 with SQLite 3.6.20.  It works fine on
Fedora and Ubuntu with SQLite 3.7.x.

To work around these problems, if we're using SQLite, test the SQLite
version inside the test that requires foreign key support,
and skip the test if it's < 3.7

Change-Id: I1c26f29371376b271a4e384ea7b5d2009651acc1
"}]
commit_message:
Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7

Fixes bug 1158828

Even though SQLAlchemy is documented to support foreign keys (with
the pragma set) on SQLite >= 3.6.19, we're seeing consistent problems
with that support on RHEL 6.4 with SQLite 3.6.20.  It works fine on
Fedora and Ubuntu with SQLite 3.7.x.

To work around these problems, if we're using SQLite, test the SQLite
version inside the test that requires foreign key support,
and skip the test if it's < 3.7

Change-Id: I1c26f29371376b271a4e384ea7b5d2009651acc1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-29 10:43:54.000000000', 'message': 'Create image api does not show all required or optional attributes.

"name" and "metadata" only occurs in the example,
but they are not specified in the "Request parameters" section.
there is no doc to indicate that if them are required or optional.

Fix bug 1158134

Change-Id: Iacf6df91e4633a32a2c6b31b9d3d660299ad800a
'}]
commit_message:
Create image api does not show all required or optional attributes.

"name" and "metadata" only occurs in the example,
but they are not specified in the "Request parameters" section.
there is no doc to indicate that if them are required or optional.

Fix bug 1158134

Change-Id: Iacf6df91e4633a32a2c6b31b9d3d660299ad800a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-07 22:03:48.000000000', 'message': "refactor: Hoist helpers.expect into package namespace

It's silly to have to import a package's submodule directly,
since in this case that only introduces another module name
that the developer has to keep track of, just to gain access
to a solitary function. This patch hoists
marconi.tests.util.helpers.expect into marocni.tests.util so
that it can be referenced more naturally by the test author.

Accordingly, the Hacking.rst guide has been updated to allow
this sort of thing (with some discretion).

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: Iad2e4f728aa4826d99bec2c599e2947a87eb5945
"}]
commit_message:
refactor: Hoist helpers.expect into package namespace

It's silly to have to import a package's submodule directly,
since in this case that only introduces another module name
that the developer has to keep track of, just to gain access
to a solitary function. This patch hoists
marconi.tests.util.helpers.expect into marocni.tests.util so
that it can be referenced more naturally by the test author.

Accordingly, the Hacking.rst guide has been updated to allow
this sort of thing (with some discretion).

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: Iad2e4f728aa4826d99bec2c599e2947a87eb5945

commit_message:
Changes to Nova for Quantum

This patch removes Quantum as an option in network.pp. If using
Quantum, just directly use nova::network::quantum instead. This
patch also enables Nova to be configured to use Quantum security
groups.

Change-Id: I162f1c5153f10150ac4997d31d3b50b702daf013

commit_message:
Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.

The sample api-paste.ini file included an insecure value for the
signing_dir option for the keystone authtoken middleware.  Comment out
the option so that we just rely on the default behavior by default.

Fix bug 1174608.

Change-Id: I6189788953d789c34456bbe150b8ed6ce6f68403
(cherry picked from commit 58d6879b1caaa750c39c8e452a0634c24ffef2ce)

[{'created': '2013-05-08 02:41:09.000000000', 'message': 'Bug # 1156429 - Correct placement of auth=no setting for Qpid.

Removed the auth="no" setting from the section of the guide it was in
which was unrelated to messaging and assumed that Qpid would be
colocated with Nova (hence the config file being updated didn't exist
for some users).

Updated the message broker installation section to more thoroughly cover
Qpid installation and set up and added missing rpc_backend directive to
the example nova.conf file for the "yum" version of the book. Also fixed
an errant prompt character in the installing MySQL material (s/$/#/)
because the introduction tells the user that the commands within the
section need to be run as root.

Change-Id: I89df0d1050c6871254001e560a45ea6189bbfe18
'}]
commit_message:
Bug # 1156429 - Correct placement of auth=no setting for Qpid.

Removed the auth="no" setting from the section of the guide it was in
which was unrelated to messaging and assumed that Qpid would be
colocated with Nova (hence the config file being updated didn't exist
for some users).

Updated the message broker installation section to more thoroughly cover
Qpid installation and set up and added missing rpc_backend directive to
the example nova.conf file for the "yum" version of the book. Also fixed
an errant prompt character in the installing MySQL material (s/$/#/)
because the introduction tells the user that the commands within the
section need to be run as root.

Change-Id: I89df0d1050c6871254001e560a45ea6189bbfe18

commit_message:
Refreshed Oslo Code

    Change to auth_tok to auth_token
    Added dependency on oslo.config package
    Remove reddwarf.openstack.common.cfg

Change-Id: I61af7a54d09f3d1d6b6efe470ea6308be8ace2e7
Fixes: bug #1175757

subject: added cell_name to admin api call for server as separate extension

Check the copyright dates.  I spotted one bad one, but I didn't look at them all.

One other comment:  I'm not sure this necessarily needs to be its own extension.  I think I'm fine with it being so, but you *could* use the current os-cells extension and use 'extensions.soft_extension_authorizer' to enable/disable the adding of the attribute via via policy.json."}, {'account_id': 6950, 'date': '2013-04-02 22:30:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-02 22:52:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Doesn't seem to work

I think we need some more tests around the policy checking."}, {'account_id': 6950, 'date': '2013-04-03 11:20:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Hi John,

Do you mean 
1) More tests to check if this specific(the one I have added) extension is loaded in diff policies settings? or 
2) More generic tests around policy nothing specific to the extension I have added?

If its (1) tests in /nova/tests/test_policy.py covers generic tests its nothing specific for a given extension. If we add specific tests per policy we will end up with lot of redundant tests which would become hard to maintain.

If its (2) please add blueprint and assign it to me i will work on it today itself. I think its better if we don't combine more than one thing in each commit. 

Thanks
Kashi Reddy"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-04-03 16:24:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: (2 inline comments)

Sorry if I wasn't clear. I just think we need to test that for a non-admin user nothing is returned, but for an admin user the correct cell is returned. I think you are only testing the later case, but I could be wrong. I have added comments in-line."}, {'account_id': 6950, 'date': '2013-04-04 20:43:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-04 21:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Works for me

commit_message:
added cell_name to admin api call for server as separate extension

Add an extension to Server API to return the cellName of a server.
This needs to be a different extension than existing server extension,
so that only interested parties can enable this.

Implements: blueprint cellname-servers-api
Change-Id: Ibcac1c5977fec3b03f389fafca264f3c98099cf4

commit_message:
Copy the RHEL6 eventlet workaround from Oslo

Tests in oslo-incubator now need the horrendous hack to workaround an
issue with eventlet on RHEL6. We've moved the patch_tox_venv tool
and redhat-eventlet.patch into oslo-incubator, so add them to
openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I1acfec282b64d7582144b155119bedb1741db2f7

commit_message:
Use conditional GET to fetch latest ubuntu image.

This also switches to using curl which some people may not have
installed. However, curl is far superior for this type of download.

Change-Id: I7ac5a84b30eb8daad320c082f976931c41a24669

In Python 2.7, if you do a regular expression substitute on a string, you get back a string, and on a unicode object, you get back a unicode object. Basically it preserves type. Thus do not need the str(value) on line 386 or str(line) on 392.

And looks like
test = re.sub(r'password: .+', "password: ***", value)

will do the trick. It is not important to have the u, and we maintain a  fixed length of *** to give no clue about password length.

And my error about upstream comment, no escaping password in request object.'}, {'account_id': 6526, 'date': '2013-04-10 09:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6526, 'date': '2013-04-10 09:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Much nicer! David & Mouad, you have massively improved the solution, adding compile, unit tests (I was scratching my head on a unit test for log files, but pulling out the change into a function and testing function was a great idea).

At the risk of annoying .. 3 comments
a) we are not worried about checking the correctness of the quotes in the original message. The two expressions _RE_PASS1 and _E_PASS2 differ in only the ' and " are interchanged.  This can be combined using  
re_compile(r'([\'|"]?password ........ etc
Need to type this one out carefully.

Then you do not need to test for first, followed by second if failed.

b) earlier comment about regular expressions maintaining input type even after substitution, thus unicode stays unicode and string stays string. Thus do not need to worry about unicode or string. That is my read of re, and my conclusion from experimenting with it. would one of you check this.

c) if you made the if-debug test outer, and the for loop inner, shall save testing on each line of the request object.

Great job!
Malini'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

thank you for the unit tests around the password masking regex mechanism'}, {'account_id': 7073, 'date': '2013-04-12 08:10:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@malini: Thanks for the comment and here is my response for your comment:

a) Actually for this point i don't have much of a view, having one regex can simplify the code at the expense of a more complicate regular expression to read, in the other hand having two regex will simplify the regex and add more code (the if part), so it's question of trade-off here ! which one is better ? ...

b) This part i am not sure about why it's needed, maybe david can highlight why he added it.

c) +1 for this change, good catch :)"}, {'account_id': 6526, 'date': '2013-04-12 08:57:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@malini/@mouad:
Here are my response:
a) Actually, I really don't the very complex Regular expression in source code which is very not easy to understand and maintain (Of cause I have very pool experience on this also :-p , I try to merge this two regular expression on today but not yet finished.)
b) If I do not use unicode(message), I will hit the following when run test cases:
 File "/Users/gengjh/MyWorks/OpenStack/keystone/.tox/py27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keystone/common/wsgi.py", line 388, in __call__
    LOG.debug('%s = %s', key, utils.mask_password(value, True))
  File "/Users/gengjh/MyWorks/OpenStack/keystone/.tox/py27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keystone/common/utils.py", line 299, in mask_password
    result = _RE_PASS.sub(secret, message)
TypeError: expected string or buffer
c) yes, it is good catch, I will fix it.'}, {'account_id': 6526, 'date': '2013-04-12 09:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-12 10:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me
