'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-05-07 06:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-05-07 06:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I appreciate the intent overall, but my gut tells me there are simpler ways to do this. Perhaps it would be easier to import the route mapper directly from each project we care about testing with Tempest into Tempest?

I just have to wonder how long this particular bit of functionality will be useful, where it has the potential to need to be updated, versus something like the above, where Tempest will *always* know what state it needs to be in."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-05-08 00:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Matt,

I can see your comment if this feature is just for tempest.
but I guess this feature will become useful for other developments by adding some options to its parameter.

The examples are "Nova v3 APIs" and "API validation".
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27276/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25884/

"Nova v3 APIs" will be implemented with the separated files from v2 APIs, and we need to implement v3 APIs by modifying many v2 APIs. If both v2 APIs and v3 APIs have this feature, we can get v3 development status by comparing them.

Also on "API validation", we need to implement many API schemas for validating API input, and we will be able to get its development status by adding some parameter to this feature, I guess.

Yamazaki-san, will we be able to use this feature for the above developments?'}, {'account_id': 6760, 'date': '2013-05-08 01:55:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Matt, Ohmichi-san, thanks for your reviews.

I think we should avoid handling route mapper directly in Tempest because the code will be capable of depending on Nova strongly.

Also, as Ohmichi wrote, this would help developers other than testing.

Ohmichi-san
>will we be able to use this feature for the above developments?
Yes, we would be able to extend this feature to v3 API because the extension framework of v2 and v3 will be similar.'}, {'account_id': 6760, 'date': '2013-05-08 02:06:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-05-08 02:14:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Please review and join this discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-May/008436.html

Let's make sure what we're discussing there covers the requirements here.  We don't want to go off and do something different."}, {'account_id': 6760, 'date': '2013-05-08 02:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6760, 'date': '2013-05-08 02:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

I will join the discussion.'}]

commit_message:
List Available APIs

To detect which API is tested in integration tests
and which is not, it is necessary to figure out what
kinds of APIs are implemented.
This adds an API to get a list of available Nova APIs.
The list would be compared with integration test data
like test logs.

The API returns
 *Method
 *URL path
 *Action
 *Brief outline
of each API.

Implements: blueprint list-tested-apis

Change-Id: I3ffb529b611bd7ecd6c73a46786500d99dc2ed91

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-07 12:10:19.000000000', 'message': "alarm: fix MongoDB alarm id

The current implementation actually fails unit test because it tries to
use alarm id as the internal MongoDB object ID. That doesn't work
because MongoDB object ID must have a certain format and length.

Rather than using a backend specific alarm id, let's just use an uuid
based one that is not tight to the back-end.

Change-Id: I9ea79fc56b8beaf1efceddeaa5e9e43b620e5e98
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}]
commit_message:
alarm: fix MongoDB alarm id

The current implementation actually fails unit test because it tries to
use alarm id as the internal MongoDB object ID. That doesn't work
because MongoDB object ID must have a certain format and length.

Rather than using a backend specific alarm id, let's just use an uuid
based one that is not tight to the back-end.

Change-Id: I9ea79fc56b8beaf1efceddeaa5e9e43b620e5e98
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Wait for any nova server status that makes sense

Nova may return some transient states based on operator actions that do
not mean a resource has failed. Rather than report these as unexpected,
wait on them just like BUILD.

Fixes bug #1140324

Change-Id: I757c073fb8a7da44f41e9a9cb9ae71dbc35d3c33

commit_message:
Add test to handle nova BUILD status on create

Other tests assume nova will return an ACTIVE server on create, which is
somewhat unlikely.

Fixes bug #1133580

Change-Id: I6ccc079e8978894f7648a6000f74869434c600f6

decorator.

commit_message:
Delete templates/ directory.

These now live in:
https://github.com/openstack/heat-templates/tree/master/cfn

Any templates that are used in unit tests have been copied to
tests/templates

JsonToYamlTest.test_convert_all_templates runs quicker now that
it only has 7 templates to convert

Change-Id: I0d69db92f7f24bd0c6526ac8226ed2b640233a83

commit_message:
Use scheduler for driving autoscaling task

For threads that drive autoscaling events, run them to completion using the
task scheduler, to abstract out the sleeping from the main code.

Change-Id: I9b21404a171d92d6edbc59d3099d3ee34f08e22d

subject: Add a wrappertask decorator
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-03 16:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/1/check/gate-heat-pep8/2828 : SUCCESS in 00:02:01
- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/1/check/gate-heat-python26/2783 : SUCCESS in 00:02:11
- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/1/check/gate-heat-python26-centos6/56 : SUCCESS in 00:04:11 (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/1/check/gate-heat-python27/2782 : SUCCESS in 00:03:08
- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/1/check/dev-heat-coverage/1280 : SUCCESS in 00:02:36 (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-05-05 04:41:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I'm worried about making the code harder to read and understand. I don't necessarily think that this does that, but it does resemble inlineCallbacks, and that is one of the most confusing parts of Twisted. So I would appreciate an example of how to live without this particular decorator."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-05-06 09:04:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I'm not familiar with Twisted, so I can't really comment on that aspect. I do believe this is different though, since GvR's PEP 3156 states that using coroutines is essentially orthogonal to using callbacks:

http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3156/#coroutines-and-the-scheduler

This patch essentially implements "function calling for coroutines":

"You may ask, why not automatically convert all coroutines to Tasks? The @tulip.coroutine decorator could do this. However, this would slow things down considerably in the case where one coroutine calls another (and so on), as switching to a "bare" coroutine has much less overhead than switching to a Task."


PEP 380 gives a very good rationale for why this is needed in the language (and the BDFL even accepted it for Py3k ;)

"To the author's knowledge, previous proposals have focused only on yielding values, and thereby suffered from the criticism that the two-line for-loop they replace is not sufficiently tiresome to write to justify a new syntax. By dealing with the full generator protocol, this proposal provides considerably more benefit."

http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0380/'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-05-06 15:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-06 15:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/2/check/gate-heat-pep8/2849 : SUCCESS in 00:02:01
- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/2/check/gate-heat-python26/2804 : SUCCESS in 00:02:00
- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/2/check/gate-heat-python26-centos6/72 : SUCCESS in 00:02:25 (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/2/check/gate-heat-python27/2803 : SUCCESS in 00:02:04
- http://logs.openstack.org/28173/2/check/dev-heat-coverage/1296 : SUCCESS in 00:02:41 (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-05-07 00:21:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks Zane. Really interesting stuff.

I'm wondering if this would be in scope for all eventlet users. Perhaps we should be driving the scheduler into eventlet, or another library to complement eventlet. It seems odd to me that Heat would own something so generic."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-05-07 09:28:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, I think there's scope for this to become a separate library later (or at least part of Oslo), maybe in conjunction with the workflow stuff that has been discussed.

commit_message:
Add a wrappertask decorator

It is common that we might want to create a task that is a light wrapper
around another task. This allows us to, for example, call some clean-up
function after a PollingTaskGroup has completed. We really want to make
sure that any exceptions caused by timeout or cancellation get passed on to
the subtask as well.

Python 3 sports the "yield from" keyword (PEP 380) that effectively allows
the sort of nesting of generators that we want to do here. This change
provides a decorator function that allows the decorated generator function
to do the same thing using the "yield" keyword, even in Python 2.

Change-Id: I110141f2891ed35b8ffe98ec6ae8b42738f7db64

commit_message:
Support password authentication.

Add alternative authentication middleware to authenticate against Keystone using
username and password instead of validating existing auth token. The benefit
being that you no longer require admin/service token to authenticate users.

To use, update heat-api.conf:
     [paste_deploy]
     flavor = standalone

This should make it possible to try heat out against existing public
clouds.

Change-Id: Ia584bba78e8984581f0fb6882bbb17d5efa238db

I was confused by the commit message since you can't have a container named x/y, I thought it meant containers named x and y and x0, but that wasn't right. Then I finally figured out it was just a typo and meant objects in a container since delimiter queries don't make any sense with listings of containers. Anyway, maybe a fresh commit message along the lines of:

-----
    
    Fixed issue with delimiter query
    
    To replicate the original issue:
    
    put acct/cont/x/y
    put acct/cont/x0
    put acct/cont/x1
    get acct/cont?delimiter=/
    
    You would get x/ and x1 but not x0 in the listing.
    
-----"}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2013-05-03 15:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-05-03 15:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Fixed issue with use of delimiter in container queries.

Currently if you have a container with objects named
x/y and x0 and you use delimiter=/ in your query, x0
will be excluded from the results. This patch resolves
this problem.

To replicate the original issue, create a container
called 'test' with the following objects:

x/y
x0
x1

Then do a GET with 'accnt/test?delimiter=/' and the
following is returned:

x/
x1

i.e. x0 is missing from output.

Change-Id: If196e3075612b121ef8da4a9128167d00a248c27

commit_message:
Fix cosmetic bug when displaying unnamed volumes

When displaying a selection of volumes while creating an instance,
volumes with no assigned name were being displayed improperly due
to lazy translation.

Change-Id: Ia89813ad7adbdabc7deba9075d3884837d4e8f75
Fixes: bug #1133174

commit_message:
Add parsing to extra-specs key check

When using the filter scheduler which is now the default,
we can no longer pass in extra-specs like: {minIOPS:500, ....},
because the capabilities filter will reject this because there is
no host reporting minIOPS:500 capabilities.

We now need to scope the keys (ie qos:minIOPS:500....), but
that unfortunately requires a fix to the SolidFire driver.

This change add a check for the ':' in the key, and parses
on it if it's there.

Also fixes backend_name and uses VERSION var instead of
generating string in stats reporting.

Fixes bug: 1167141

Change-Id: Ie7fd7d231af78cb18a13f44a4379b44d3c3385df
(cherry picked from commit 0e3ea4e85dab00b7cecd5596f6daa65cc4d710b5)

commit_message:
Update service test case - V3

Adds a test_services.py test script so as to validate the update
service. And the rescpective support methods to "service_client.py"
in both json and xml interfaces

Change-Id: Ic088861049a2642076bbca166c84f234dfb6a290
Implements: blueprint keystone-v3-service-api-test

commit_message:
Give each cli its own test.

This will give a nicer failure message, and results in 3
slowish tests instead of 1 really slow one.

Change-Id: I5c3fbd2507068908c165e163b8f458bf8cb00bc1

Implements: blueprint bp/volume-snapshots

commit_message:
Support SnapshotId in volume creation.

This uses cinder backups as snapshot, to be symmetrical to the deletion
policy.

Change-Id: Ie8f1ff095df7bdad8500c6298d1b7d9fd233693f
Implements: blueprint bp/volume-snapshots

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-07 16:14:23.000000000', 'message': 'Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Eventlet address resolving doesn't support IPv6. This is causing the
gate to fail.

The failure happens when the dnspython package is installed in the
environment. When dnspython is there then eventlet takes over
getaddrinfo, and eventlet's getaddrinfo doesn't support IPv6. If
dnspython isn't there, then the eventlet patching doesn't happen
and IPv6 address resolution works.

It appears that the pip dependencies have recently been updated
so that dnspython gets installed now.

The fix is to skip the 3 tests that force the server to listen
on "::1".

Fixes bug 1176204

Once eventlet is updated, we can add the tests back in. Here's the
eventlet code in question:

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/src/e0f578180d7d82d2ed3d8a96d520103503c524ec/eventlet/support/greendns.py?at=0.12#cl-166

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f
'}]
commit_message:
Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Eventlet address resolving doesn't support IPv6. This is causing the
gate to fail.

The failure happens when the dnspython package is installed in the
environment. When dnspython is there then eventlet takes over
getaddrinfo, and eventlet's getaddrinfo doesn't support IPv6. If
dnspython isn't there, then the eventlet patching doesn't happen
and IPv6 address resolution works.

It appears that the pip dependencies have recently been updated
so that dnspython gets installed now.

The fix is to skip the 3 tests that force the server to listen
on "::1".

Fixes bug 1176204

Once eventlet is updated, we can add the tests back in. Here's the
eventlet code in question:

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/src/e0f578180d7d82d2ed3d8a96d520103503c524ec/eventlet/support/greendns.py?at=0.12#cl-166

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f

commit_message:
LDAP list groups with missing member entry

Using the LDAP identity backend,
if a group member entry doesn't exist in the LDAP server anymore
and the group's members are listed using GET /v3/groups/{groupId}/users,
Keystone returns 404 Not Found.

The server should return all the group members that do exist
and ignore the missing members,
and probably log a warning message about the missing user.

Fixes bug 1174585

Change-Id: Idf7c8c7f87affc4a72c5fe5e18e09a0f362e2646

commit_message:
Fix ability to add custom volume_backend_name

This patch fixes the ability to set the volume_backend_name
for each driver.   The original bug was filed against LeftHand
and 3PAR, but several drivers exhibited a fixed backend name.

Fixes: bug #1175222
       bug #1172286

Change-Id: I4197f99bebd6ca8e4969795ae6edb537bc066c90

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-06 21:49:04.000000000', 'message': "change test_register_http_image to use explicit url

previously test_register_http_image did some black magic with
sending an image into swift then using swift as an http server
for the purposes of this test. However there is no other requirement
in this test that swift is actually running, so it breaks under
a default devstack env (and possibly other enviroments).

The real test is whether an http image can be pulled into glance.
Use the cirros image as a default, but allow people to specify
another value if they don't have internet access.

Change-Id: I3800f4bf7174b85aab747f0c7fe911acac033383

commit_message:
change test_register_http_image to use explicit url

previously test_register_http_image did some black magic with
sending an image into swift then using swift as an http server
for the purposes of this test. However there is no other requirement
in this test that swift is actually running, so it breaks under
a default devstack env (and possibly other enviroments).

The real test is whether an http image can be pulled into glance.
Use the cirros image as a default, but allow people to specify
another value if they don't have internet access.

attempt to fix pep8

Change-Id: I3800f4bf7174b85aab747f0c7fe911acac033383

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-05 06:32:29.000000000', 'message': 'improve VMware Nova docs, including most new grizzly items.

bug #1106404
bug #1100147

The existing VMware Nova docs were very outdated, incomplete,
and in a few cases, just plan wrong.  They also did not cover the new
VMwareVCDriver and associated updates that arrived in Grizzly.  This
commit removes a lot of stale content (and even graphics) and adds the
basic instructions for both the VMwareVCDriver and the VMwareESXDriver.

I filed an additional bug for some topics (disk details, vnc) that
I did not already cover (bug #1175000)

Change-Id: Id6a4c9022e07f82622aa40eedd0449956f0475e8
'}]
commit_message:
improve VMware Nova docs, including most new grizzly items.

bug #1106404
bug #1100147

The existing VMware Nova docs were very outdated, incomplete,
and in a few cases, just plan wrong.  They also did not cover the new
VMwareVCDriver and associated updates that arrived in Grizzly.  This
commit removes a lot of stale content (and even graphics) and adds the
basic instructions for both the VMwareVCDriver and the VMwareESXDriver.

I filed an additional bug for some topics (disk details, vnc) that
I did not already cover (bug #1175000)

Change-Id: Id6a4c9022e07f82622aa40eedd0449956f0475e8

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Thank you very much!'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The problem is that tmpfs does not use "free" RAM as traditionally defined. It stores files in the space that would normally be occupied by filesystem cache/buffers. So you could have 0 RAM "free" and still take advantage of tmpfs.

This is really just too complex for too little gain. The tmpfs helps out most with dpkg because it calls sync() a lot. However, it is still at best about 10% speed-up in build time. For a big-RAM box it is worth it to have your cache/buffer space used entirely for this process. But for anything smaller, it will just cause more problems than it will solve.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I've hit this problem too"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Seems the minimum amount of memory we need to build an image is 2G, so instead of checking the total physical memory in the machine wouldn't be better to check if we have at least 2G of free memory available and pass it as an argument to the mount command?

I'm ok giving a +1 to this patch as it is right now as well, just throwing up a suggestion."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Yes sorry, I know linux concept of "free" memory is a bit different but by free I meant also the ram that will be free up by the system if the application need it.

Anyhoo, I also agree that doing all this checks would be too complex for little gain, let's keep it simple :). That said, LGTM!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/28105/6/gate/gate-diskimage-builder-pep8/425 : SUCCESS in 00:00:08
- http://logs.openstack.org/28105/6/gate/gate-diskimage-builder-python26/418 : SUCCESS in 00:00:41
- http://logs.openstack.org/28105/6/gate/gate-diskimage-builder-python27/419 : SUCCESS in 00:00:25
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

[{'created': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'message': 'Limit TMPFS size to 4GB and fall back gracefully.

For machines with low RAM (or no access to /proc/meminfo) the builder
will still run, but will just build inside the filesystem that is
hosting /tmp. This will result in a slower build (especially if there
are a lot of .deb packages installed).

A new environment variable is introduced, DIB_TMPFS_SIZE, to allow users
to customize this for special environments.

Fixes bug #1175453

commit_message:
Only use tmpfs if build machine has 4GB+ RAM.

For machines with low RAM (or no access to /proc/meminfo) the builder
will still run, but will just build inside the filesystem that is
hosting /tmp. This will result in a slower build (especially if there
are a lot of .deb packages installed).

Fixes bug #1175453

Change-Id: I79f2672058c11e377548820df0ab4fad8f47ffdc

commit_message:
Fixed typos and deprecated parameters

Removed the old parameters in nova.conf examples to interact with
nova-volumes (code is removed in grizzly).
Removed duplicate commands to sync nova database.
Changed the ids in Ch7: Verifying the Image Service Installation to
reflect those created in the Glance chapter.

Change-Id: Ie587f258ce3bafff0d32842e2da5115afcff41f9
Fixes: bug #1176908

[{'created': '2013-05-07 15:36:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix *-paste.ini to use keystoneclient.

We do not want glance to need all of keystone, just the version of this
middleware that is included in keystoneclient, which will be pulled in
by the pip requires of glance.

Change-Id: I4cef706a7c8f260454863205b7824daac867848d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix *-paste.ini to use keystoneclient.

We do not want glance to need all of keystone, just the version of this
middleware that is included in keystoneclient, which will be pulled in
by the pip requires of glance.

Change-Id: I4cef706a7c8f260454863205b7824daac867848d

commit_message:
Log msg for load policy file only if the file is actually loaded

The Load entry was previousy in init(), whereas it should have
been in _set_rules() which is invoked only when policies are
(re)loaded from the json file.

Change-Id: Ib4ce66569a64fc4be8f5f77d7f503cc93ac0006e

[{'created': '2013-05-07 15:25:01.000000000', 'message': 'update-port error if port does not exist in nvp

Previously the NVP plugin would query NVP for the quantum port id that was
stored in the port as a tag in NVP. Later, a look up table was added in order
to directly look up the ID without having to go to NVP. The problem that can

commit_message:
update-port error if port does not exist in nvp

Previously the NVP plugin would query NVP for the quantum port id that was
stored in the port as a tag in NVP. Later, a look up table was added in order
to directly look up the ID without having to go to NVP. The problem that can
arise is that if a port was created in folsom before this lookup table was
added and then deleted from NVP directly an error will be raised when calling
update_port(). This patch fixes this potential problem.

Fixes bug 1172006

Change-Id: I08c74e305449f7fe32897abf43ceb430c959b02d

commit_message:
Nova evacuate failed when VM is in SHUTOFF status

When the VM is in SHUTOFF status and the original compute host is
down, issue the "nova evacuate" command to rebuild the VM on
another host, it is failed due to a type error: string indices
must be integers.

Fix bug 1176773
Change-Id: I76ebce6882198365717167f29a484e4ec994db0c

commit_message:
Change format of some judgments

Because "not volume" will be True if volume id is 0.It can not
distinguish 0 from None.The same to some other judgments where
variable value may be 0.

This patch also does the following changes:
Deletes check storagepool in function _check_conf_file and adds
check default iscsi target IP in function initialize_connection.
Moves create host group from do_setup to initialize_connection.
Changes _get_login_info to be _update_login_info.

Also fixes some formatting issues in log messages that are
fixed in master.

Fixes bug: 1160340
Change-Id: I0434b587d57c783f10d5724c4c66aea5df0b32e5
(cherry picked from commit a3848ed80d7306833a87b1f7cfa3f89b58ab744a)

commit_message:
Adding new test for iSCSI live block migration

Requrires a new config value as the test depends on a
specific patch being made to XAPI to support the
relax-xsm-sr-check behaviour

'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2013-05-04 23:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

There's no need to do: apt-get install -y keystone python-keystone python-keystoneclient

Simply doing:
apt-get install -y keystone

is enough, because the other packages are pulled by dependencies.

The same way:

apt-get install -y nova-api nova-cert nova-common nova-conductor \
     nova-scheduler python-nova python-novaclient nova-consoleauth novnc \
     nova-novncproxy

there's no need to ask to install python-nova or python-novaclient.

The same way, this:

apt-get install -y glance glance-api glance-registry python-glanceclient glance-common

can be replaced by:

apt-get install -y glance python-glanceclient

You wrote:

"The Grizzly version is not yet available in Debian Wheezy official repositories since some packages are still under review by its community."

Grizzly will *never* be in Wheezy. Maybe one day in backports.debian.org, if I can find the time to do it, but not in Wheezy proper, the same way Grizzly will never be in Precise.

Apart from that, I agree with your changes.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-05-04 23:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-05-04 23:27:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thomas, thank's for review. Let start the work by something which works. I've fixed your last sentence, but I'll optimize packages later."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-04 23:28:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

You'll also need a pom.xml that contains debian as one of the options so that we can test the output."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-05-05 12:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-05-05 12:43:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

Thank's for your help"}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2013-05-05 18:29:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (20 inline comments)

style: Fix flake8 and hacking errors

In the interest of conforming to the de-facto coding standard for
OpenStack projects, this patch enables all checks for flake8 and
hacking, plus fixes everything reported.

Also, several docstrings were edited for clarity and grammar.

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt

I seem to remember this was done on purpose in the agent scheduler blueprint during grizzly.
The reason for that was to give admin users a chance to manually schedule networks; auto-scheduling is postponed to when the first port is created on the network.

I think gongysh, markmcclain and danwent can provide more inputs on this as they followed the work on agent scheduling more closely than me.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-07 14:25:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

ok, thanks. i'll wait for their inputs. what i have seen is the following:
1. if the dhcp agent was started prior to the network being created then it would never be updated
2. new networks would not update the dhcp agent (this may be due to the scheduling that you mentioned)
3. the NVP has the support for the scheduling"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-07 14:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-07 14:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi,
You are correct. This is my bad. Not a bug.
Thanks 
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-05-07 14:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not merge

this is by design, which enable admin can select which dhcp agent to host the network manually after the network is created.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-07 14:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

This is not a bug and was a problem in the setup'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-07 05:58:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove security_group_handler

Now that nova's security groups are more plugable and decoupled from the
database the security_group_handler code is not very useful so this patch
removes it.

A little info about the security_group_handler:
The security_group_handle code was added to provide a hook into nova security
groups so that one could get security group add/delete/update notification
and proxy them somewhere else (i.e quantum). Trying to actually using this
method opens one up to several transactional issues because in the current
implemenation the security group is commited to the nova database before
security_group_handler is called.

Implements blueprint: remove-security-group-handler

Change-Id: I45047fe8dbb81555505e03309838910113080c37
"}]
commit_message:
Remove security_group_handler

Now that nova's security groups are more plugable and decoupled from the
database the security_group_handler code is not very useful so this patch
removes it.

A little info about the security_group_handler:
The security_group_handle code was added to provide a hook into nova security
groups so that one could get security group add/delete/update notification
and proxy them somewhere else (i.e quantum). Trying to actually using this
method opens one up to several transactional issues because in the current
implemenation the security group is commited to the nova database before
security_group_handler is called.

Implements blueprint: remove-security-group-handler

Change-Id: I45047fe8dbb81555505e03309838910113080c37

commit_message:
Fix 500 raised on disassociate_floatingips when out of sync

If one deletes NAT rules directly from NVP and not through quantum,
an error will be raised when deleting a port that is associated with
the floating ip. This patch catches the NotFound exception and logs
it so that the port can successfully be deleted.

Fixes bug: 1177176

Change-Id: Ia7d0b94957d0c6b014d242439245b0e4fa9de40d

commit_message:
Update oslo before bringing in exceptions

I want to bring in the base OpenstackException for
the alarm api, so first updating what we currently have.

Change-Id: I8128f3420eac9ab42a9d679c7b291bac1f27e5b0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 16:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'Convert unicode for python3 portability

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html:

Python 3.0 uses the concepts of text and (binary) data instead of Unicode
strings and 8-bit strings. Use six.text_type to Type for representing
(Unicode) textual data. This is unicode() in Python 2 and str in Python 3.

Change-Id: I3da268a714a34a8e626a2590f01b86e414dc3411
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-05-03 17:10:28.000000000', 'message': 'Convert unicode for python3 portability

commit_message:
Convert unicode for python3 portability

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html:

"Python 3.0 uses the concepts of text and (binary) data instead of
Unicode strings and 8-bit strings."

Use six.text_type to Type for representing (Unicode) textual data. This
is unicode() in Python 2 and str in Python 3.

Change-Id: I3da268a714a34a8e626a2590f01b86e414dc3411
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Re-work test_cli to use testscenarios.

The cli tests were already organized in a manner that lets testscenarios
do what it does. Reformat the code a little bit to be a single test plus
a list of declarative combinations of scenarios and let testscenarios
do the work of turning that into a set of test cases.

Change-Id: I4e10d9eaeb313c724f0012babac465e37be4fa3d

commit_message:
Measurements documentation update

Nova measurements:
- add cpu_util
- del disk.io.requests, disk.io.bytes
- add instance unit to instance:*
- fix some errors on type and unit

for all measurements add new column 'Origin' : notification|pollster|both

tag : DocImpact
Fixes: bug #1164032
Change-Id: I6ce3ff186e700ba425f2a3d78d153866620c1580

Hi,

> - 1/ does the test has to test the multi-backend feature (so, if the feature is not activated, the test is simply skipped)

If your goal is simply to ensure that volume allocation works even when multi-backend is enabled, I believe there are other tests doing exactly this and you don't need one more.

I assumed you were trying to test that allocating from two different backends actually use two different backend and provide useable volumes.

You can test something else, of course. My point is that if you test something that does not depend on the multi-backend patch, you should change the title of the test.

Cheers"}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-03-18 15:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-03-18 15:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-18 15:50:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Doesn't seem to work

Jerome, I think you're doing a good job and understand that delaying again might be causing some frustration but I'm not sure that having a test which assumes both backends are of the same size is safe.

I'm not sure what is other people opinion on this, this looks more a test for the scheduler. We may achieve similar result by setting up two hosts with differently sized backends and check that both volumes are on the same host. Maybe other (simpler) configurations are also testable.

I think we should get more people into the discussion and see what pops up.

My suggestion is to keep the code as it is for now and add a blueprint in launchpad, setting it in "discussion" state and see if any suggestion comes up.

note: I've added a comment inline too'}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-04-23 10:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-04-23 10:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

The test "test_multi_backend_with_same_volume_backend_name" was removed from this patch.

As Giulio has mentioned it, this test is not directly linked to the multi backend functionality (it's more dedicated to the test of the filter scheduler). A more generic discussion (outside the scope of this patch) has to be done.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-04-23 10:28:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(2 inline comments)

the new tests are good, but we need to remove some of the automatic skips, otherwise this test suite can pass even when this functionality is broken in the implementation.

In general we want to get away from skips except when based on a feature flag in the config file (which you have, which is good). So the user can specify up front the features they expect to work, and tempest ensures that those actually do."}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-04-26 13:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: (2 inline comments)

We don't do this everywhere yet, but have started doing it."}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-04-30 09:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-30 10:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-04-30 10:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

Hi,
thanks again for the comments :) Here is a new version with a try/except in setUpClass calling tearDownClass manually in case of exception.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-04-30 16:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

Christopher:
If the setUpClass fails we have very high chance to have a failure in the tearDownClass.

We should call the LOG.exception before the tearDownClass.'}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-05-01 11:21:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

Hi all,
thanks for spending time in reviewing this patch :) I think the work is nearly finished.

We need to have a consensus to finalize this patch. The issue is about catching exceptions in the setUpClass. Let me summarize the different possibilities:

1. let the patch as it is now (patch 21): as afazekas mentions it, if setUpClass fails, there will have very high chance for tearDownClass to fail too. However, there is a case where the manual call to tearDownClass can be useful: if the backend2_name doesn't refer to a name configured in cinder.conf, setUpClass will create volume1, then it will try to create volume2, an exception will occur, tearDownClass will be called, all created stuff will be cleaned properly.  

2. no try/exception at all in setUpClass (patch 20): this is the case in a majority of tests, however, as Christopher mentioned it, the new method (try/exception in setUpClass) has just started, this is why a majority of tests doesn't have it.

Even if things can be better (of course, they always can be better :D), maybe we can have a concensus with the possibility 1 (patch 21)? In all cases, new patchs will be able to correct the try/exception if it's really needed latter (in this patch and all the other tempest tests), but I think (maybe I wrong) the discussion around the try/exception is not directly linked to the multi backend tests.

Let me know what do you think about this, and if you are agree, don't hesitate to vote!

Thanks a lot."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-05-02 14:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-05-06 13:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

I agree with afazekas that we should LOG.exception, but otherwise I vote for what is in 21.'}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-05-06 14:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 6828, 'date': '2013-05-06 14:09:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

Christopher, Afazekas, thanks for your feedback.

Patch 22 does a LOG.exception. I didn't find much examples of LOG.exception in other tests, so let me know if it's not what you were expected.

Thanks a lot."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-06 14:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Works for me

'}, {'created': '2013-03-18 15:47:28.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Cinder Multi Backends Tests

Adds a new file containing 3 tests:
- test if the multi backends feature is working: "os-vol-attr:host" should
  return something like: "host@backend_name"
- test if the filter scheduler works well with the multi backends
  feature. The same volume_backend_name is used for the different backends: the
  scheduler should distribute the newly created volumes between the
  backends
- test if the creation of a volume with a specific volume type is
  created in the good backend

The tests need 3 backends (configured in cinder.conf) to work properly.
This patch introduces new tempest configuration variables:
- cinder_multi_backends: skip the tests if it's set to false
- backend1_backend2_name: name of the two first backends
- backend3_name: name of the third backend

Change-Id: I82d533e0737ffde54b3829f2a8b91c75641f2639

commit_message:
Adds Cinder Multi-Backend Test

Adds a new file containing 1 test:
- test if the multi backend feature is working: "os-vol-attr:host"
  should return something like: "host@backend_name"
- test if the creation of a volume with a specific volume type is
  created in the good backend

2 backend (configured in cinder.conf) are required to work properly.
This patch introduces new tempest configuration variables:
- multi_backend_enabled: skip the tests if it's set to false
- backend1_name: name of the first backend
- backend2_name: name of a second backend
(backend1_name and backend2_name must be different)

Change-Id: I82d533e0737ffde54b3829f2a8b91c75641f2639

GroupEvenSpreadWeigher allows to spread instances from definite
group between all accessible hosts. It is necessary to pass a
scheduler hint, using group as key and name of the group as value,
when booting an instance.

Add tests for this weigher.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ieca90f9bf4a84159724ff5479131b53af8d34eed
'}]
commit_message:
Add GroupEvenSpreadWeigher for nova scheduler

GroupEvenSpreadWeigher allows to spread instances from definite
group between all accessible hosts. It is necessary to pass a
scheduler hint, using group as key and name of the group as value,
when booting an instance.

Add tests for this weigher.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ieca90f9bf4a84159724ff5479131b53af8d34eed

commit_message:
Update entrypoints list before running tests

Makes sure that nova.egg-info/entry_points.txt has any changes made to
setup.cfg before tests are run.

This is needed for subsequent patches that use the new
entrypoint-plugins to load nova extensions.

blueprint entrypoints-plugins

Change-Id: Ie2462f67eb3bcaf9fc06b9cf906f667dd4527870

commit_message:
Support Snapshot policy in volumes

This handles the Snapshot DeletionPolicy in the AWS::EC2::Volume
resource, creating a backup of the volume before deleting it. It
requires a recent cinder client with backup support.

Implements: blueprint volume-snapshots
Change-Id: Idbb14a434ad6ccde9f198e07799e8aef0867dd6f

commit_message:
Sync oslo-incubator print statement changes

Just changes openstack.common to use the new print statements.

This is in preparation for another sync coming shortly for the
scheduler library.

Change-Id: I17a86ef87f3253d6bb756cbd40a3ff5df9be23ff

commit_message:
Delete InstanceSystemMetadata on instance deletion

Thanks to no-db-compute only pre-delete instance data is used in
notifications. So now we can go back to deleting InstanceSystemMetadata
when an instance is deleted.

Fixes bug 1153827

Change-Id: Ic66b998cde2a15a24f302f08c34753a8b57da73d

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I'm a bit confused by the concept of RPC-over-HTTP, why not just use a plain ol' REST API? 

(I suspect calling a mechanism "RPC", but which is not RPC-over-AMQP in the traditional openstack sense, would cause confusion ...)

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-03 11:35:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hey Eoghan,

Just like v1, this API is meant to be used by glance-api and not exposed to the outside world. The difference is that it is meant to be used by a registry-db-driver[0]. The idea is to make it easier to implement new methods to the database API without having to modify the registry's API.

The benefits of doing so are: 

1) it reduces the places where things need to be modified when implementing new features in the DB side,

2) It reduces duplicated code

3) This will help migrating Glance's API v1 to use the database driver, which will allow users using glance-api v1 to deprecate the registry if they whish so.

The reason why an message broker was not used is that it doesn't make sense to add more dependencies (like MB, libraries) for this feature that is suposed to be kept simple. However, there are some queued blueprints that might require having a MB in glance, if that happens, we could definitely consider replacing RPC-over-HTTP with something based on that.

Does that makes sense?

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/registry-db-driver"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-06 23:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-05-06 23:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-06 23:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-22 15:21:43.000000000', 'message': "Implement registry API v2

This patch implements registry's API v2 based on the blueprint
registry-api-v2.

Major changes:
    * The new registry API is implemented using a small rpc protocol
      over http. Resources must be registered and the exposed methods
      will be automatically discovered (they must start with rpc_).
    * Registry's API now returns data as returned by the db-api. The
      idea behind this is to provide a db-like api that can be used as a
      db-driver leaving to glance-api the responsibility for cleaning
      up what will go out to the client.

Minor changes:
    * Split unit/v1/test_api.py in 2 separate test files (for
        consistency with v2 unit)
    * Added test_registry to unit/v2/

Change-Id: Ia9f6eb60f52bb093e807a8a89d4df89fb80c4336

commit_message:
Implement registry API v2

This patch implements registry's API v2 based on the blueprint
registry-api-v2.

Major changes:
    * The new registry API is implemented using a small rpc protocol
      over http. Resources must be registered and the exposed methods
      will be automatically discovered (they must start with rpc_).
    * Registry's API now returns data as returned by the db-api. The
      idea behind this is to provide a db-like api that can be used as a
      db-driver leaving to glance-api the responsibility for cleaning
      up what will go out to the client.

Minor changes:
    * Split unit/v1/test_api.py in 2 separate test files (for
        consistency with v2 unit)
    * Added test_registry to unit/v2/

Implements blueprint registry-api-v2

Change-Id: Ia9f6eb60f52bb093e807a8a89d4df89fb80c4336

I think that an empty table is a more appropriate response than a blank line for a list command returning no entries.  And while I think it's important to establish backwards compatibility for the internal API that's exposed, I don't see it being problematic to have updated the cli output in this case."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-04-29 15:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I agree, I prefer the empty table.  That tells the user that novaclient did something and got an empty result.  Without that kind of output, it may appear to a user that novaclient did nothing.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-04-29 20:14:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I don't particularly care either way, although I stumbled over it as one of my wrapper scripts failed (it expected the output of an empty table to be small). 

Problem is that we'd need to raise the PrettyTable requirement to >= 0.7.2 in order to enforce the empty_table=True variant (it did not exist before as far as I read the code). Otherwise tests will fail with an old PrettyTable release being installed."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-07 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

commit_message:
Restore compatibility with PrettyTable 0.7.2 update

This reverts commit 69f9971da54b46a8883148e4cef6346c7933b6ec

PrettyTable 0.7.2 defaults to print a table even if
the resultset is empty, which breaks the unit test and
also backward compatibilty. Restore previous behavior
to be in line with older prettytable releases.

Fixes bug 1166464

Change-Id: Ifaf5a91cefab1e85a35c5371793331c6bf83def4

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-04-05 02:43:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

termie: we can't remove support for this until havana+2"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2013-04-05 04:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Dolph: this is 1800 lines of code that adds alternate code paths to half of our codebase, move it to a frickin extension'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-04-05 13:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Moving it to an extension is fine.  That does not include removing the unit tests, or removing the CRUD.  The token revocation chaining needs to stay as well, and will be needed for Oauth as well, unless we can completely remove token revocation across the board.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2013-04-05 19:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

ayoung: it exactly does mean removing the unit tests and the crud and putting them in a separate area of code, i agree it will be annoying to move out of the codebase due to how many places you touched, but it does not belong here and should not have been implemented in this way to begin with'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2013-04-05 19:39:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

ayoung: by implemented this way i am not referring to "as trusts" i am referring to your coding decisions of adding the feature as additional conditions (and often branches) of already existing code, it directly complicates the existing code when it could have kept reasonable separation of concerns and been additive rather than mutative (for lack of a better word).

"domains" did the same thing and that was also wrong.

If we do not keep a clean codebase we will end up like every other crappy enterprise solution to this problem in the world, and while I am sure that will make somebody plenty of money we will have screwed ourselves over with a world of thousands of paths through the same function and endless contradictory settings. It is unmaintainable, ugly, and something that other developers will point at to demonstrate wrong decisions.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-04-05 21:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

termie: i don't disagree, but the "move it to an extension patch" needs to be in review as well... if not the same commit'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2013-04-05 21:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

dolphm: the code still exists in grizzly for ayoung to write his extension against, and i can help him write it. 

Having all this extra stuff around waiting to be ripped out is a pain for me trying to fix the rest of the stuff i am working on.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

commit_message:
Fixed bugs in test_s3_ec2_images

*State variable reference was missing
*Fix state variable no longer required
*tests deregister_image functionality
*removes skip from test_register_get_deregister_ami_image
*Modified according to comments in prevoius patch

Change-Id: I852251cc293b8723fbe4383644a1402f274c5dca

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-06 19:09:15.000000000', 'message': 'Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Eventlet address resolving doesn't support IPv6. This is causing the
gate to fail.

The failure is somewhat erratic in that it requires that the dnspython
package is installed in the environment. When dnspython is there then
eventlet takes over getaddrinfo, and eventlet's getaddrinfo doesn't
support IPv6. If dnspython isn't there, then the eventlet patching
doesn't happen and IPv6 address resolution works.

The fix is to skip the 3 tests that force the server to listen
on "::1".

Fixes bug 1176204

Once eventlet is updated, we can add the tests back in. Here's the
eventlet code in question:
https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/src/e0f578180d7d82d2ed3d8a96d520103503c524ec/eventlet/support/greendns.py?at=0.12#cl-166

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f
'}, {'created': '2013-05-06 19:10:37.000000000', 'message': 'Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f
'}, {'created': '2013-05-07 02:23:57.000000000', 'message': 'Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Eventlet address resolving doesn't support IPv6. This is causing the
gate to fail.

The failure happens when the dnspython package is installed in the
environment. When dnspython is there then eventlet takes over
getaddrinfo, and eventlet's getaddrinfo doesn't support IPv6. If
dnspython isn't there, then the eventlet patching doesn't happen
and IPv6 address resolution works.

It appears that the pip dependencies have recently been updated
so that dnspython gets installed now.

The fix is to skip the 3 tests that force the server to listen
on "::1".

Fixes bug 1176204

Once eventlet is updated, we can add the tests back in. Here's the
eventlet code in question:

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/src/e0f578180d7d82d2ed3d8a96d520103503c524ec/eventlet/support/greendns.py?at=0.12#cl-166

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f
'}]
commit_message:
Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Eventlet address resolving doesn't support IPv6. This is causing the
gate to fail.

The failure happens when the dnspython package is installed in the
environment. When dnspython is there then eventlet takes over
getaddrinfo, and eventlet's getaddrinfo doesn't support IPv6. If
dnspython isn't there, then the eventlet patching doesn't happen
and IPv6 address resolution works.

It appears that the pip dependencies have recently been updated
so that dnspython gets installed now.

The fix is to skip the 3 tests that force the server to listen
on "::1".

Fixes bug 1176204

Once eventlet is updated, we can add the tests back in. Here's the
eventlet code in question:

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/src/e0f578180d7d82d2ed3d8a96d520103503c524ec/eventlet/support/greendns.py?at=0.12#cl-166

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-07 02:39:16.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure heatclient shows body of errors

Previously the code tried to iterate over the response from the
server twice, leading to an empty error message being shown to the
user, or a nasty backtrace since the code expected a full string.

Fixes bug #1177163

Change-Id: If6c2e9b5a010198d70a5a84611c63b4e4d265fe4
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure heatclient shows body of errors

Previously the code tried to iterate over the response from the
server twice, leading to an empty error message being shown to the
user, or a nasty backtrace since the code expected a full string.

Fixes bug #1177163

Change-Id: If6c2e9b5a010198d70a5a84611c63b4e4d265fe4

commit_message:
Fixes 3PAR FC driver synchronization

While running  stress tests we found missing synchronized methods.
This patch added synchronized anotations around the necessary
methods.

Fixes bug 1172503

Change-Id: I8e475fe38d96ca663fbaac40c5a50420d791f5d5
(cherry picked from commit beacbd368124a656eaa4038fe1c35f1796e5dda4)

* tools/pip-requires: python-memcached 1.50 is broken and cannot be

Change-Id: I80034e0c603157912edc40d33991c66e09fb494f

commit_message:
Pin python-memcached to 1.48 as 1.50 is broken.

* tools/pip-requires: python-memcached 1.50 is broken and cannot be
installed via its setup.py file. Pin python-memcached to version 1.48 as
this is the previously known working version of python-memcached.

Change-Id: I80034e0c603157912edc40d33991c66e09fb494f

commit_message:
Making param 'size' optional for non-volume support.

Param 'size' is only needed when volume-support is enabled.
When volume-support is not enabled, ie using root partition or ephemeral,
the size is not needed.

LP bug 1175719

Change-Id: Iaf891e70fd24ad59a6a5034fd1e6fd798f0d7282

commit_message:
Keystone auth in cinder.conf instead of paste-api

cinder.conf supports [keystone_authtoken]. This commit moves the
keystone auth info to cinder.conf so the admin doesn't need to
edit api-paste.ini

Change-Id: Iede28f90a00a65b9c5942191a22a1ec915021c38

commit_message:
Cleans up the keystone manifest

This patch makes the following changes to the keystone auth manifest:

  * Fixes the tenant variable in the Keystone_user_role notification
  * Modifies the tests to account for the above point

Change-Id: I94716b165750f0a89112028608b78ff6712c54de

commit_message:
Changes to the init manifest

This patch makes a few changes to the init manifest:

  * Adds a documentation header
  * Adds a root_helper parameter
  * Removes the rootwrap_conf option
  * Removes the rootwrap.conf file
  * Formatting fixes

Change-Id: I8c15a7227296aecd94174fce9df8c7067d673e3d

commit_message:
Patch for minidom's writexml has been added

* patch applied only for python < 2.7.3
* unit tests added for patch and xml conf generator
* it has been tested at python 2.6.7, 2.7.2-2.7.4

Fixes: bug #1174841

Change-Id: I6db89a06a4fa86b62a582d0188d0b7f1a508dcd2

commit_message:
Remove referances to LegacyFormatter in example logging.conf.

A recent change (Ibe41afc6e9d7b432453785819821b3c8f0078613), removed
nova.openstack.common.log.LegacyFormatter, and replaced it with
ContextFormatter.

This change updates the example logging config file to reflect this
change, as any reference to the now-removed LegacyFormatter causes
nova services to fail to start.

Change-Id: I55a984ed7ea12c1dde49c4eb13d5b4f47471bf95

commit_message:
Update nova logging.conf to reflect changes in nova trunk.

The "LegacyFormatter" was recently removed from nova in this
change:  3e136dea2b259def305c9032cab5e1a08243c1c6.

As a result, the nova logging.conf template in this repo contained
an undefined reference to nova.openstack.common.log.LegacyFormatter,
causing nova services to fail to start.

This change replaces LegacyFormatter with ContextFormatter.

Change-Id: I9ef9610e2707dc2a9966c777172e365cc75fbb97

subject: Improve EC2 error response code.
messages:
[{'account_id': 6717, 'date': '2013-02-06 19:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6717, 'date': '2013-02-06 19:11:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This is my attempt of first step towards compliant EC2 error messages in nova.

Please let me know if this is right direction. If so, I'll also modify unit tests to reflect the changes in next patch set.

The big question is whether _ is acceptable in API specific exception name or not. If not, all exceptions with messages containing . will require special treatment.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-06 18:59:38.000000000', 'message': 'Improve EC2 error response code.

Redundant logging code was united in new _ec2_error() helper function and all
EC2 error responses are now uniformly logged on DEBUG log level because they
are just responses to invalid client requests, not nova errors.

Proper EC2 error codes are returned where possible.

Excpetion name is used as EC2 error code instead of cryptic UnknownError in
case of unexpected error.

EC2 API specific exceptions should have EC2 suffix and contain _ (underscores)
instead of . (dots) for automatic translation which is done by new
exception_to_ec2code() function. InvalidInstanceIDMalformed was renamed to
InvalidInstanceID_MalformedEC2 in this manner.

This is a first step towards compliant or at least meaningful EC2 error codes.
Next, EC2APIError must be replaced by proper EC2 or OpenStack exceptions.

Implements blueprint ec2-error-code

Change-Id: Ic9e845bd6d3d4d400119828ae6b9c8deedaa3dd6

commit_message:
Improve EC2 error response code.

Redundant logging code was united in new _ec2_error() helper function and all
EC2 error responses are now uniformly logged on DEBUG log level because they
are just responses to invalid client requests, not nova errors.

Proper EC2 error codes are returned where possible.

Excpetion name is used as EC2 error code instead of cryptic UnknownError in
case of unexpected error.

EC2 API specific exceptions should have EC2 suffix and contain _ (underscores)
instead of . (dots) for automatic translation which is done by new
exception_to_ec2code() function. InvalidInstanceIDMalformed was renamed to
InvalidInstanceID_MalformedEC2 in this manner.

This is a first step towards compliant or at least meaningful EC2 error codes.
Next, EC2APIError must be replaced by proper EC2 or OpenStack exceptions.

Implements blueprint ec2-error-codes

Change-Id: Ic9e845bd6d3d4d400119828ae6b9c8deedaa3dd6

commit_message:
Add xtrabackup to the guest-image for backup / restore

We need to bake xtrabackup into the guest image so that we
can run tests for backup / restore scenarios.

Fixes Bug 1175847

commit_message:
Unpin disk-image-builder and bring back cloud-init

* The reddwarf-guest element was purging the cloud-init package
  which is required to correctly size the root partition
* unpins disk-image-builder so we can build from tip once again

fixes bug 1175878

Change-Id: I3b2f702302051827d84e20fa1b8e76e4ad1d6b92

commit_message:
Makes the guest work for more than just mysql.

* Moved code around to accomplish this
* Renamed a few msyql specific methods
* Used the guest_info config file since it contained
  the service_type already

implements blueprint reddwarf/guest-multi-impl

Change-Id: I12a1f08499355802dba35ca14ec38b8f0dc5dfa4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-06 17:02:31.000000000', 'message': 'Adds POST method support in the metadata service

Fixes bug: #1092311

The password generation feature introduced in Grizzly requires POST
support in the metadata service.

Support has been added to both the metadata agent and namespace proxy.
Tests have been added and updated accordingly.

Change-Id: If7ef6bede1775ad682822cb868518ec732b90805
'}]
commit_message:
Adds POST method support in the metadata service

Fixes bug: #1092311

The password generation feature introduced in Grizzly requires POST
support in the metadata service.

Support has been added to both the metadata agent and namespace proxy.
Tests have been added and updated accordingly.

Change-Id: If7ef6bede1775ad682822cb868518ec732b90805

Default to single-version-externally-managed

The other thing is always confusing and never what people want.

commit_message:
Add config for skipping authors and changelog.

Swift does not want to autogenerate these - so allow them to configure
them off.

Change-Id: I815fcbf9ec8d20f4a1c6cb4e2fe68a2ba8d1e305
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/27519
Reviewed-by: Clark Boylan <clark.boylan@gmail.com>
Reviewed-by: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>
Approved: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Update to d2to1 0.2.10.

We fixed a string bug upstream which was released, and also added some
additional backwards_compat options.

Change-Id: I636a47952a90e6e0df864dbdc9243b77eeb6d77e
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/26968
Reviewed-by: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>
Approved: Clark Boylan <clark.boylan@gmail.com>
Reviewed-by: Clark Boylan <clark.boylan@gmail.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
style: Migrate to the new hacking package on pypi

This removes the cloned Nova hacking.py in favor of the new OpenStack
hacking package on pypi. The new hacking module is a flake8 extension,
so running pep8 separately is no longer needed, and has been removed.

Note that some errors are currently being ignored; those will be fixed
in a followup patch.

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: I9d34b21d872a872b8c927717367023d3214ff38d

commit_message:
Changed mode of /var/log/nova to 0750

If directory is world executable, it means when somebody
knows proper filenames (and everybody knows default names)
then the directory is "vulnerable".

Change-Id: Icdd68f5178debdd2368d3c02c94419be4f2935a8

commit_message:
xenapi: Always set other_config for VDIs

The existing code only set `other_config` on a VDI when it was created using
`create_vdi`. This patch updates the code so that `other_config` is also set
when a VDI is created from a dom0 plugin or during a migration.

Also included is a one-time script to set the other_config for existing
VDIs that were affected by this bug.

Fixes bug 1162029

Change-Id: I4fa856754487f77ce9c8e39d45eee7ea5187123e

commit_message:
Convert to using oslo's execute() method.

There are some small warts (mostly around other execute() like
methods which reuse the exception). I will fix these warts in later
reviews.

Change-Id: Ice9cdbdc5f3e5a9f8365f5d99acf1863a9fe3e7a

commit_message:
Adds a timeout to launchpadlib connections.

The default timeout in LPlib is None which means it will just
hang. Lets set our default to 5 seconds to fix any queries
that hang.

This fixes an issue which started a week ago (when a new
version of LP was released) where reviewday would just hang
when trying to query LP for some of the bug/BP information.

Change-Id: Ia7af4efba543b25d220ccb193abbabc20b9f489f
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/28315
Approved: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Reviewed-by: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-02 12:31:33.000000000', 'message': 'Correct documentation on swift container names.

Null characters are no longer allowed (since grizzly)
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/constraints.py#L203

Max container name length is 256, inclusive.
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/proxy/controllers/container.py#L122

Change-Id: Idf52f730fc1c83d8e1cee11676ee0c6e797cc4fb
'}]
commit_message:
Correct documentation on swift container names.

Null characters are no longer allowed (since grizzly)
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/constraints.py#L203

Max container name length is 256, inclusive.
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/proxy/controllers/container.py#L122

Change-Id: Idf52f730fc1c83d8e1cee11676ee0c6e797cc4fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-04 23:08:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix stub_instance() to include missing attributes

The stub_instance() function aims to create a fake instance dict,
but omits several attributes present on the real database object.
This patch adds them. While they're not used anywhere (obviously)
at the moment, some WIP code I'm working on expects them to look
like the DB object, and thus fails.

Change-Id: I71fb596f8b0a80de21ee58ef378440da8eea1777
"}]
commit_message:
Fix stub_instance() to include missing attributes

The stub_instance() function aims to create a fake instance dict,
but omits several attributes present on the real database object.
This patch adds them. While they're not used anywhere (obviously)
at the moment, some WIP code I'm working on expects them to look
like the DB object, and thus fails.

Change-Id: I71fb596f8b0a80de21ee58ef378440da8eea1777

commit_message:
Add a test for creation of volumes' snapshots.

A new test called 'test_snapshot_create_get_delete' is added.
Also adds setUpClass and tearDownClass methods to create a
shareable volume origin.
Finally updates the existing 'test_volume_from_snapshot' which
now uses the create_* and clear_* wrappers from base class and
the shareable volume origin from setUpClass method.

Change-Id: I3fb8edabaf4649736a43d6de5a9c4518d3caac62
Implements: blueprint add-snapshot-tests

commit_message:
style: Enable flake8 with proper exclusions

This patch ensures we are running flake8 in a DRY fashion, using the same
exclusions as used for pep8. Also fixed is the pep8 module version mismatch
between the version required for hacking.py and the newer version used by
flake8. Finally, the doctest run for pep8 was removed, and enabled for
nose instead.

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: I8e19512df4cd37f7ad637b66dff0a5982d14482c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-06 12:19:30.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp server tunnelling fix.

NetApp vserver/vfiler api tunnelling in concurrent requests
can cause routing request to incorrect servers in race conditions.
This fixes the api and driver for the mentioned situations.

bug 1176759

Change-Id: I83d883cad39f35465f7b3ac1877297a1983437ee
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp server tunnelling fix.

NetApp vserver/vfiler api tunnelling in concurrent requests
can cause routing request to incorrect servers in race conditions.
This fixes the api and driver for the mentioned situations.

bug 1176759

Change-Id: I83d883cad39f35465f7b3ac1877297a1983437ee

commit_message:
glance/cinder/quantum counter units are not accurate/consistent

change floating ip counters to 'ip' unit
change volume.size counters to 'GB' unit
change image.[update/upload/delete] counters to 'image' unit

Change-Id: Icdb92b3edf08d9cf9ea555b3bdfe7d452dd3ffff
Fixes:bug1173287

- http://logs.openstack.org/27660/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/19822 : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-05-06 08:02:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

A few comments on this patch for helping reviewers.

- Why did I do this?

At the summit we discussed possible way for improving db handling in quantum. One of the problem we highlighted was that we were not doing queries in a scalable way on get requests; also the way we're currently handling with extension forces us to define extend_<resource>_dict_<extension> method in the mixin class and call them from the plugin.

- What am I doing here?

Changing the logic in which objects are loaded from the db, instructing sqlalchemy to perform an outer join with 'extended' data tables. In the example of this patch, we'll be loading security group mappings together with a port.
Incidentally, I am also trying to devise a solution for avoiding calls to 'extend_dict' methods in each plugin, which could be quite helpful as far as maintainability is concerned.

- What I like about this patch?

The simplicity in which the joined load relationship has been added to the port model. It's just a setattr; and does not even need a migration.

Also, it's nice to see how we can leverage python mro to have all mixin classes report to the 'mail' db plugin class their 'extend_dict' methods. However, mro is quite tricky too; the solution you see in the code comes with the drawback that it's unlikely to work if the db base plugin classe is not the 1st in the mro order.

- What I do not like about this patch?

First, I had to change each plugin code for initializing a variable. This is because plugin classes are explicitly asked to not invoke super.__init.__; I think this is not a good practice, and this should be fixed.
(yes, I could have avoided doing that for each plugin anyway, I know :) )
The problem here has to do with the fact that Quantum tries to create the database from the models at startup. Since we now have migrations in place, this capability should be removed as it clashes with the migrations.

Second, I added a method for stripping non-model attributes out of a dict representing a request. This is because in several places we update the SqlAlchemy model with a python dict; while this works, the method I have implemented assumes the name uses for the model attributes are the same as the ones we use for API attributes. While this is pretty much true for all quantum resource, this is not enforced nor mandated anywhere.
The root cause for this problem is probably that we should not mix and match python representations of data (ie: dict at the moment), with SqlAlchemy representations; in the meanwhile we can choose to adopt this bit of code which relies on 1:1 mapping between API resource attributes and Data Model attributes, or do something different.

- What was particularly difficult while developing this patch?

The patch itself was trivial.
Without exaggeration, over 50% of dev time was spent on understanding which was the cause of unit tests failures, and adapting 'test' plugins for the changes in this patch. At the moment it is pretty much impossible to understand why a unit test fails because the failure in an assert is usually cancelled somewhere, probably in the context manager functions which are invoked everywhere.
Hopefully, Maru should come up soon with something for our unit tests."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-05-06 08:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

Not really, because we're not fetching anything for port bindings from the db, is that right?

It applies anyway to plenty of other extensions."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-05-06 08:02:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I've reworked the approach using the same one we adopted for model query hooks.

Ideally I would like this to be done into the constructor rather than class-level member initialization. On the other hand, since the plugin is a singleton anyway, it probably does not matter much.

Since we're not using anymore _setup_dict_funcs I have been able to remove calls to it from __init__ in plugin classes, resulting in a shorter diff."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-06 08:02:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Yes, you are correct, the port bindings are currently not taken from the DB. This may change with Yong's patch to include the host ID for each port.
Thanks for the clarification.
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-06 08:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Hi,
Just a question not related - is this also valid for the port bindings extension?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-05-06 08:02:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Perform a joined query for ports and security group associations

bug 1174111

Instead of loading security group associations with a separate query
each time a port is loaded from the database, perform the load operation
with a join using a joined sqlalchemy relationship.
Also, this patch removes the need for invoking the mixin method
'extend_port_dict_security_group' from the plugin code.

Change-Id: I40b22281d45ff4f4bf8149211883799a9051c1a0

Hi, Alessandro, thanks for your reply, and may I ask what would you suggest?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2013-04-26 15:42:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-04-26 17:41:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Is there a bug/blueprint for tracking the long term fix for this? If there is it would be worth it to include it in the commit message here so that this isn't confused as the long term solution."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-04-26 17:52:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

From further discussion on #openstack-nova, one idea consists in creating an agent to shrink the guest FS partition before the resize, this will allow the VHD to be resized by the driver.

The guest os feature can be implemented either in the existing cloud-init (Linux) and cloudbase-init (Windows) or a blueprint should be started for a new agent.

About the current patch, I vote for abandoning it.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-04-26 18:22:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Do not merge

From the discussion in this review and on IRC, it sounds like this needs a mailing list thread to figure out what the proper way to handle this is.

Further, I don't think that just ignoring the fact that the resize can't happen is the Right Thing here.

Please, whoever is interested in pursuing this, start a -dev mailing list thread on the topic.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-04-26 18:33:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

One additional note on the erros status.

I agree on the fact that the instance should not be put in an (irreversible) error state as a result of a failed resize attempt, but at the same time, ignoring the error would result in applying the target flavor only partially, e.g. by changing the memory size but not the disk size, which is unacceptable.  

In case of error we should make sure to roll back to the original flavor with proper error reporting (more than ignoring the error with a message in the logs).'}, {'account_id': 7040, 'date': '2013-04-28 01:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

To Dan, actually we already send out a discussion to the mailing list, but just one response yet, please feel free to response.
To Alessandro, as I said earlier, ignore the resize operation is unacceptable, but throw a exception which cause customer data to be lost is worse.'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-04-28 06:56:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

In order to avoid a permanent error state for the instance, for the moment a simple approach could consist in doing a flavor compatibility check at the beginning of the resize operation, still raising an Exception in case of resizes to smaller disk sizes (as proposed by vishy during a chat). I have to check if the manager retains correctly the state of the instance in case of exceptions, but in case this would require filing a bug for the manager.

Sorry for my delayed replies, I've been traveling in the last two weeks and I'll be back at the office on Monday."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-06 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-06 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Fix hyperv resize to smaller flavor error

This patch is a work around solution for the hyperv driver
resizing error, when the disk size in new flavor is smaller
than current size, the resizing operation will be skipped.
This patch just make hyper-v driver consistent with libvirt,
powervm and xen driver before find out a final solution.

Fixes bug #1163844

Change-Id: Ibb15713b98648652c836f6a0eb7c6dc3b5b03435
